title: does ring want more money? - older devices malfunctioning so you can upgrade?
content: first i purchased the ring doorbell 2 like 4 months ago. it worked fine at first then it started having problems wouldn't capture motions quickly enuff. it would skip some motions. the image would get blurry. i contacted help/support and i really didn't like the process i had to go through to get a new device. which might have been refurbished at best. so i decided to upgrade to 3plus. now i cant use the subscription i paid for with doorbell 2. i need a new subscription and i lost my old recordings. i emailed and still haven't gotten a response from the company. what i did get is emails about this review. flimsy cover didn't like how it doesn't fit properly feels like i might break it someday when changing batteries. they are lying about 1080p - the image quality is like 240p. they say its 5ghz capable? its mostly connected to 2.4ghz at the router is like 7 feet away. pre roll not so great - doesn't work at night -low quality image - i guess its okay in the daytime, it does the job now and i can see whats going on. at night when my security lights go on the night vision deactivates and visibility is worse than ring doorbell 2. kinda disappointed i had to shell out this much money in the last few months for the service. 2 devices and 2 subscriptions 4 batteries. they keep emailing me to remove this review. im not going to remove it because its been a few weeks already and they haven’t responded to my initial email about paying for a new subscription. also the new app update sucks - they took away landscape mode and now it only works in portrait mode. i might return this before my return window closes and try the nest doorbell. update 05/15/2020 - they removed the 3 minute snapshot feature for battery owners. what are u guys nuts? running the company to the ground? now you must buy a solar panel charger or hardwire for 3 min snapshot feature. update 9-02-20 ring app has more bugs and problems then before. i have no idea why they tinker with it to be worse. update 11-07-22 they censor and delete comments of  the neighbors and give you the illusion that your voice counts; also I suspect they are mining your data and selling the data also....prob bots... Not cool yo!
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: AMZN CUSTOMER
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Great features, but disappointed.
content: Upgraded from Doorbell 2. The pre-roll was a great feature and worked pretty well. However, I had to return it and put the Doorbell 2 back because the 3 Plus kept dropping WiFi randomly (hardwired and mesh WiFi router with in 5ft from the doorbell, tried both 2.4Ghz and 5Ghz). Live view would rarely work because of it. I could only see the camera when a motion was detected or someone pressed the doorbell. My Doorbell 2 never had this problem. I think the doorbell would just put itself in sleep mode and disconnect from WiFi. But with “Live View” on, it should never disconnect from WiFi. I would love to keep the 3 Plus, but until they fix this issue. I’m gonna have to return it.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Jill T.
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Fail
content: This is my first Ring product. I thought I was moving up from some other cameras I have around the house.  Not so sure about this. I'm very familiar with setting up security systems and wifi enabled devices.  I've had the motion range set to only my porch and it went off all night being set to medium sensitivity. I adjusted the camera to angle down more this morning and bumped the sensitivity up to Max since it's only facing the immediate area outside my door with easily 20ft with no trees,  bushes or movement beyond the motion zone.  So being happy that I think I solved the issue,  I'm currently upstairs working and my dog starts going nuts. I look out and the mail man is going back to his truck to get my second load of Amazon packages. He comes back again to my front door directly in front of my Ring cam. My $29 Wyze cam picked it up and went off. My generic $69 Chinese camera picked it up from the garage angle. My $229 Ring cam mounted directly in front of a mailman at my door twice failed.  No notification whatsoever. Everything is set correctly and if this happens one more time it's going back. UPDATE:  The next morning..All settings such as motion areas and sensitivity have somehow changed back to what they were on their own.  I changed my password just incase this thing is hacked. My wifi strength is good and I doubled checked ALL my settings early this morning and as of right now I'm sitting having breakfast and my phone buzzes from my other brand camera so I look out my window and see the mail truck ONCE AGAIN leaving my house and sure enough there's a package sitting right below this Ring Doorbell. No notification at all from Ring. So at this point my $29 camera is 100% more reliable than a $229 Ring camera. Right before I wrote this I looked at Live View and it keeps saying "trying to reconnect". Pressed it 15 times.  Nothing. Going to be calling them today.  If there's no upgrade bug fix in the VERY near future Ring Doorbell 3 Plus is getting replaced with another brand. UPDATE 2: Just hung up with support and they tell me it's wifi issues. " I should buy a Chime Pro" or contact my internet provider. Well.. I have 3 other cameras way further than this Ring Doorbell and come to think of it this is the closest one to my router. I have excellent wifi throughout the property. After reading other reviews that have had no success with purchasing the Chime Pro to correct "wifi issues" I think I've made a decision. So dissapointed.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: JazzyNYC
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: So much better than the original.
content: Cheaped out the first time and got the original. We had it for about a year and it worked well, but the quality was garbage. So I got this one (ring doorbell 3) and the quality is so much better. I would recommend not getting the original and buying this one.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Emily Owen
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Great potential — but Launched with Bugs
content: Was super excited to Finally get this doorbell — been waiting almost 2 months for the release — I have the Ring Security System and this doorbell really completes it — especially pairing with my Schlage Lock — I can now unlock (Or lock) my door directly from the Ring app when someone is at the door. So after all that waiting, I was super disappointed that they shipped me a defective unit. ;( the battery was on pace to die after 6-7 days. *I’ll describe it more fully below* Ring customer support was great and they are shipping me a new one through Amazon. Will update my review after I test that one. ****Review Update 4/25, right before the replacement ring arrived they updated the firmware and magically my doorbell started to charge and finally reached 100%, as it should have). I’ve noticed it drain down to 95% a few times over the last month, but clearly this was an early firmware issue that they resolved. Future orders should be fine ****** In terms of quality picture — it’s fantastic. Ease of installation — awesome. Performance — works great, detected all relevant motion and has nice features to reduce false positives and non human motion. Integrations — love how it connects into my smart home tech (I.e my Schlage lock) AND the Amazon Integration is great with my Echo Show — the alert comes to my kitchen device and the live video pops up on the screen if the doorbell is pressed. The only integration that sucks is with my Samsung Fridge — nothing pops up there — but truthfully that is Samsung’s fault — they have gone downhill from their vision and their marketing no longer matches what their products actually do. Whoever makes end user software decisions is clueless and un-customer centric — probably a lawyer. The only reason I am rating this 3 star — is they shipped me a defective unit. Serious battery drain. Ring It’s supposed to get ~6 months of use before the battery needs recharged, BUT I connected mine to a strong power source and so it should not only (not drain) but simply sit there, trickle charging, and acting as a backup. Instead my battery went down like 15% in one day. That means it only would have lasted like 7 days. Which is ridiculous. Especially considering I connected it to a primary Power Source — it should never die. I talked to Ring Support — who was great — and they said my doorbell was constantly restarting itself and draining the battery. So they told me to ask amazon to replace it. I’m keeping it at 3 stars until I receive and can test the replacement. But man, what a disappointment. Be careful, if mine is any indication they launched this product with bugs. Maybe it’s hardware, maybe it’s firmware. While I wait for the new device to arrive I noticed ring pushed a firmware update last night and my battery drain has slowed substantially.  So that is a positive sign that they are fixing the issue.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: JWK
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Installation is easier with a drilling template.
content: I found the Ring Doorbell 3 Plus really easy to install -- once I realized I needed a drilling template.  I'm surprised they don't include one in the box. I simply used a 3x5 inch index card and a 1/8" drill bit to make a template from the doorbell's mounting holes.  I then transferred the relative locations of those holes to my brick wall using a sharpie.  The index card was necessary because I couldn't get a pen, pencil, or marker to fit through the mounting holes in the doorbell itself! Software setup was easy.  I had to repeat the Wi-Fi setup a couple of times to get it to work, but I didn't do anything differently on the later attempts. So far, I'm thrilled with this device.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Jeffrey Wheeler
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Satisfied customer
content: I moved my 1st generation Ring Doorbell to the back door and installed the Ring Doorbell 3 at the front door.  The field of view, responsiveness, sound quality and quality of the picture are much, much better on the Ring Doorbell 3 than the first generation unit.  It also limits the motion response to just the area I selected unlike the old unit that over responded and picked up the movement of cars and trucks more than 30 feet away even though I had adjusted it to be less responsive.  I'm very satisfied with the new unit.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: David Chenoweth
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Price difference from Ring.com
content: I installed the device yesterday. It works GREAT and it is simple to set up. Soon we'll look into getting more devices for better home security.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Kevin
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Great device
content: Don’t listen to the negative reviews. It was easy to connect to my SmartThings and setting up wifi is similar to google. When you connect to the network you have to disconnect your existing network and connect to the device with your phone or tablet. I was able to connect it through my existing hardwire doorbell and my existing doorbell ring worked as well. You just have to go through the ring app and turn that feature on. The video is clean, vivid and not choppy. I connected to my 5ghz network and the signal works just fine. I tested it multiple times with no issues. When someone rings the device my doorbell rings and my Amazon Alexa announces someone is at the front door. A banner popups up and on it and live view activates. The ring service is $30 a year. I also tried it through my fire tv and when asked show me the front door my TV screen went straight to live view. No app needed. Just remember to add the ring skill on your Alexa software and do a search for the device to add it. Once that’s done your set. I barely looked at the directions to set all this up.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: John
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Disappointed.
content: Not impressed.  Been messing with settings for 4 days and can’t stop it from notifying me every time a car goes by and missing half the people that walk up on my porch.  Turned off zone that includes street but still get notifications.  Bought to replace cheaper doorbell because it had same problem but no settings to change.  Thought this would be better. But it is not.

author: Scott A.

title: Update: Over all happy with purchase
content: Updated: Sept 11, 2020. Changing to 5-star rating for two reasons, the outstanding customer service, and receiving a replacement that is working 100% the way it should. There were many emails back and forth to try and get my ring 3 working. After trying all possible remedies customer service sent me a new ring 3. I installed it 2 days ago and it is up and running without any of the problems I had in the past. So if you do have a problem rest easy knowing the Ring backs up their product and will make it right. Here's the pros/cons for me. Great picture quality and night vision are the pros, motion detection is really the only con I have. Even though I have set up the detection for the 5-15 feet range and have blocked 3 of the 4 areas you are allowed to it is still picking up traffic going by on the street which is about 40 feet from the door. Short of putting up a wall on my sidewalk (which I am sure the neighbors would love) I do not see any way of fixing this. I notice that many other reviewers have the same problems with setting distance and motion detection. Not sure if Ring will/can do a software fix for this but they should. So I guess that annoying detection is better than none at all.

title: My door would be kicked in before getting a notification
content: I was expecting real time notifications and expected to be able to use Echo Show to see who is at the front door. That doesn't happen 90% of the time. Forget about notifications thru the ring app on my phone. Sometimes that happens in a minute or 2, sometimes not at all. Yeah, I see what the answer will be if I call support..."WiFi connection". Well the router is 6 feet away, with only the wall that the ring is installed on between the 2. My Echo Tap can connect thru the house 50 feet into the back yard but this thing can't from 6 feet away thru a 3" wall. I mistakenly thought this would give me some level of security.

title: Made in China Junk
content: Only thing worse than the device is Ring support (for those who can't read the instructions they will read it to you).  $229.00 and they tell me my device must be defective.  I guess the quality control in China is not up to par.  The that idiot asked me if I wanted them to exchange it for me.  I told them, "So you can't even tell me why it won't connect to my wifi or what the problem is but yet your telling its defective?  And I'm supposed to trust RING to exchange it?"  Not thanks, I returned to Amazon and they refunded.  Even my $50.00 printer can connect to my wifi, this stupid thing wouldn't connect while holding it 12 inches from the router.  Do not recommend.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Flatwoods
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: So bad it made me cry 3 times and have an anxiety attack
content: I’m a third generation carpenters daughter. I also work in the tech field. I know tools. I know instillation. I know electronics. I’ve assembled and installed literally everything from furniture to appliances in our entire house. Installing this product made me cry 3 times, have an anxiety attack, and have to take medications to calm down. I’ll admit I was having a bad day already when I tried to put this thing together.  But the instructions are ABSOLUTELY ABYSMAL! I had to watch 3 Yoitube videos just before I could figure out how you’re supposed to attach the stupid slanting brackets. The device told me it was “entering setup mode” after I put in the battery, and then sat there blinking for 35 minutes. Finally I got mad, tried to figure out what what happening, and discovered that I was supposed to be setting it up on the app while it was doing this. There was zero mention in the instructions of this. I thought “setup mode” meant it was looking for WiFi, or triangulating it’s location or something like that. How am I supposed to known that when it says it’s entering setup mode I’M supposed to do the setup. There are zero instructions on what the different screws and things are for. I can’t even finish explaining all the nightmares involved in setting this nightmare up. Setup sucks, the product sucks, the quality sucks. I hated it out of sheer spite for what it put me through for several hours during setup, but now I absolutely loathe it for how crummy and confusing it is. If it ever breaks I’m not returning it, I’m just going to throw it in a bonfire and dance around it. Horrendous product
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Brenda W
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Don't Blame Device for User Error
content: I had my 3 Plus installed in less than 5 mins. You will have to charge the battery for many hours though to reach full capacity. Connected to my 5Ghz Ubiquiti access point SSID with no issues. RSSI of 57 which is just fine. For the people complaining about dropped signal what's your RSSI? Anything steady over 60 can cause video issues. Anything over 70-75 you'll be dropping the connecting. Over 80 forget it. In reading the negative comments several things come to mind: This unit is placed outside. It's a whole other ballgame when you place a wifi device outside of your home. My access point is in the main hallway ceiling around 25 feet from the doorbell through a stucco exterior wall and gets plenty of signal. There are around 6 different settings pertaining to motion and motion detection that have to be set right for your particular location. It took me a day to get it all set right. This is consumer DIY alarm equipment. This isn't a $3,000 wired professional alarm system install with a $35 a month monitoring contract. For the $300 in equipment I've invested and the $100 a year pro motioning plan I'm more than satisfied with Ring. Will add on some smart lighting and a spotlight camera or two next.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: James
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Some issues, pretty great overall.
content: The thing works. It damn well better by version 3, but still. I haven't found any real glitches. The one major issue I have so far is that you are not able to set the pre roll (which is the camera recording the 4 seconds before motion is detected so you get a better view of what happened) to color and higher definition. They say that's to conserve battery power, which is beyond stupid considering the vast majority of people have their Rings hardwired. If there's one thing I can't stand it's a company removing the option of choice from the consumer because they think they know better, and that's exactly what this is. Especially obnoxious because the preroll footage is completely unusable and pointless. I've attached a snapshot of what the preroll footage looks like, and another of what the footage looks like in normal mode a split second later. From garbage to actually usable. But everything else about the product is pretty outstanding. Hopefully they will change the preroll options in the future.

author: Yayi C
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Turn off your VPN to set up!
content: My neighbor recently stopped by with some pictures of a sketchy character on his porch.  I had some cameras set up but my coverage was a little lacking so I went ahead and bought this.  It arrived quickly and I took to installing and setting it up right away.  First issue- I couldn't get an account set up.  I kept on getting error after error while trying to set it up on my iphone.  By chance I turned off my VPN and it magically allowed my account to be created.  The rest of the setup process was a bit of a grind as random errors and freezes plagued the process.  I think the VPN was turning itself on and that was creating the problems. Now on to the install.  My existing doorbell is wired into the door moulding and with a storm door also attached there was little room for the Ring Doorbell to attach.  I solved that problem by cutting a block of wood to fit next to the moulding so that the Ring would have something to attach to (not so easy since I have fiber cement siding).  Once that was done install was easy. Now that it's installed I have the same problem with the VPN.  I have to turn it off to connect to the doorbell, but it's a minor inconvenience until I find a workaround. The picture quality is great, the motion detection (at least for me anyways) is a work in progress (seems to pick up movement of flowers and flags).  I originally hooked it up to my existing chime but once I found out that you can use your Alexa devices to ring throughout the house I set it up that way.  You have many ring tones to choose from (including some seasonal).  Pretty cool. Overall my particular setup was a little involved but now that it's running I would certainly recommend.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: pshultzma
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Old body, New features
content: So this product was a bit of a confusing thing to me due to looking exactly like the RVD2 and yet they still have that model vs replacing it with this. Now a bit of context here, I use to work for Ring for over three years during pretty critical product launches and then quit a year after Amazon acquired them (Amazon ruined most of the Ring spark that made it good working there). So overall I'll lay out the good and bad for you Pros- 1080p video that looks better then both the peephole and RVD2 - snapshot (captures an image every hour or 14 minutes depending on your selection) - overall a better motion sensor then RVD classic and RVD2, which means less false motion at least in my case - I think there's been some improvements internally to increase battery life as this now lasts then my previous RVD2 - Adjustable motion zones - 2.4ghz and 5ghz Wi-Fi support - Privacy zones Cons- Outdated and boring looking design - Pre-roll feature will show on the RVD3 but does not work, it's restricted to the $30 more expensive Video Doorbell 3 + which I think is a poor decision as that device shouldn't exist and is clearly Amazon trying to milk more money from consumers for a small feature - Ring Protect Plan is still too expensive in my option and should offer a plan that is half priced for say storing the videos for 30 days instead of the 60 that it normally does (you can remotely save videos on your PC/Mac if you login in online if you needed to save an important one. Also Ring will say "They can't recover or access your videos if you didn't have the protect plan" but that's totally false, they can and will but normally act like it's impossible. I've seen it done from an angry customer requesting them and they will also "find" them if you get a police subpoena for a crime ) So in all this really isn't worth the extra cost if you can get the RVD2 at $100-$150, and the RVD3+ is utterly pointless unless you REALLY want that extra 4 seconds of video before a motion although it's not going to work all the time and looks bad in night vision. 5.5/10

author: Regular guy

title: Video Doorbell 3 Plus - Still not fully refined.
content: Update: 5/27/20 Ring customer support reached out to me based on my review. It was determined that wifi signal was less than optimal. Connected doorbell to ring chime which increased a signal a bit. After a week, the cheap Ring Chime signal to the doorbell declined and would no longer perform well as a signal repeater.  So I switched back to connecting Ring doorbell directly to wifi router.  Signal remains a steady -45 (Ring told me the range was fine and they like to keep it under -50 or so). The primary reason for the Doorbell update is the fact that the product does not work as advertised. It has some fatal flaws which are consistent and repeatable and I would certainly imagine are well known. 1. You cannot view the doorbell live until AFTER the motion detection and video has completed processing. Imagine you receive an alert that "motion is detected" or "someone is at your door" and you want to quickly view what or who it is.  You can't.  Let me repeat:  You cannot view live events.  20 seconds for the video capture, another 10-15 seconds for "video processing" .............. and NOW you can connect to your doorbell in LIVE VIEW. RING...please update your product features to say:  "View your historical events after the burgler is gone" and "You can view your doorbell camera live only when nothing is happening and there is no active events occurring" I have tested this use case dozens of times.  I can sit in the same chair in my office and GO LIVE and view my doorbell in live mode within 4 seconds.  However sitting in the same chair, receiving a RING Doorbell alert... forget it.  May as well take another couple sips of coffee because you're not viewing anything live until the doorbell is done processing the event.  (I was also told that they made a new app "RAPID RING" I suppose to help circumvent the issue.  I used that app as well.  Same thing - works great... when you want to view your quiet front porch but won't go into live view when there is an active event occurring). The second big flaw:  The doorbell has a feature which allows you to only receive motion alerts when people are detected. This is a great feature because I want to capture the cars that go by in the street but don't need to be alerted.  This feature works great at night and mid-day.  Somehow the artificial intelligence of the system cannot identify a car driving by in the morning or dusk.  It's the funniest thing because around our house, we know it's around 6-7am  and 6-7pm all the time because we'll start getting a barrage of "unverified motion" events to our devices.  Then as soon as it turns night somehow the doorbell begins recognizing that the motion is a car again and quiets down. Overall, a very frustrating piece of broken firmware and app software. p.s. I won't even go into what occurs when you install the software on multiple devices.  Let them explain the settings to you.  (some settings propogate to all devices when you change them on one..... other settings you have to change on each and every device.  what a lazy mess of a software debacle). ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Overall a good product but NOT as refined as I had hoped for a brand new version of the hardware and software. 1. I paid extra money for the Ring Doorbell 3 PLUS for the pre-roll feature. (captures the moments before motion is detected).  The pre-roll feature is black and white, which I knew ahead of time, but the quality is just not good enough to make the feature worth while. It provides no value and certainly not worth the extra price difference for the Video Doorbell 3 base model. 2. Contacting the doorbell to view it live to see who is there is sporadic. Sometimes it's instant and sometimes it just sits there and waits. This is a critical feature. I need it to contact and connect to the Doorbells live view from the cloud each time, every time, all the time. 3. The software has new features but installing it on more than one device and it gets "wonky" Tweaking the settings somehow get out of synch (especially so if you also use the new Ring Chime - sounds and alerts, etc.). 4. They should offer the Ring Cloud service Free for Prime Members. The product is pointless without paying the montly subscription fee.  Since Amazon owns Ring, why make the loyal customer feel like they are getting "Ring Dinged" What I do LOVE about the product is it's ease of installation and setup. (STRONG ADVICE:  Charge the battery FULLY before installation and setup. If you fail to do this, the software may always indicate the wrong charge levels. It took nearly 5 hours to fully charge the battery). The battery is removable and replaceable.  I installed and attached to existing doorbell wires. Hooking up the two wires took 5 minutes and the wires continue to recharge the battery. The daytime video quality is excellent.  The motion detection and the ability to tweak motion parameters is also excellent.  (I appreciate the flexibility the software provides to allow me to set up motion detection for everything including cars driving by, but only alert me if it detects an actual person). As I said, overall, a good product. a bit more refinement was expected.  I overpaid for the PLUS model which I would not recommend. I trust performance and software updates will improve but should be rock solid already and it's just not.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Very overpriced anyway but Ring app makes it unusable.
content: It gets two stars because it works sometimes and when it does, the quality is excellent. There's a been a lot of hype about Ring's cameras, in particular the doorbells. I bought 2 of the 3+ models. The video quality is admittedly good. That's about it. Sure, it's a nice looking design, but that's not what I paid a premium for. That's the positives. There's really nothing else to sing about. The FOV is 160, which I thought would be enough. It might be if I put the doorbells at waist level. It was my hope that I could use these to prevent package theft but there's enough of a blindspot that if a person bent over, they could shove something in their pocket and walk away without the action even being witnessed. You'd see the person come to your door, bend over and then leave. So over $200 for circumstantial evidence. I thought about just getting the cheap model with the 180 FOV because the other features would be enough but then I remembered the Ring app. The app makes the doorbells completely unusable. Let me start by saying that my door is literally 3 feet from my dual-band router so it's most definitely not that. Let's forget for a moment that the UI is terrible. Really bad. For example, to even delete each of the bells I had to search through 3 menus deep, all of them called "Settings". There's more but that's a good example. But aside from the UI, it simply doesn't work. 4/5 times, if I clicked "Live View" it would try for about 30 seconds saying "Activating" but then complain it couldn't. I had to keep tapping "Retry" and eventually it would connect. The motion sensors don't always work and I don't mean small motions. I initially intended to elaborate on this review, but I spent so much time trying to get it to work that I don't have it in me anymore. I've wasted enough time on these. And I haven't even addressed that if you have 3 of these units, you'll also have to pony up another $9 a month regardless of whatever else you have with Amazon (like Prime) or how much you've spent.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Christopher Estep
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Not good for security device
content: I purchased the ring door bell a few weeks ago. It comes with one month of free recording service that requires the payment of a monthly subscription after that. I searched for a way to connect it to a dvr but there is no interface for that. At least not to the end user. There must be something or the company would not be able to record either. With the use of the service the response time to allow you to view what was recorded is very slow. By the time the device connects to your internet and displays the video, that the person and or motion created, so much time has elapsed that the event is over and the person is gone. There is also no way to just watch in real time what is going on. By this I mean that there is no way to display a constant feed on a monitor inside your house. Alexa will display the live feed but only for a short period of time. The lag time is so great that there is no way to really answer your door remotely. By the time you know who is there they are leaving and could just as easily breaking in. Pro: good camera resolution good night vision Con: No way to connect to DVR Subscription fee required to continue remote recording lag time to great to be an effective security device

title: Not really worth the $$
content: 8/2/20 Update—- same problem. Customer support got it working but now I haven’t had a live picture since 7/17. It will not reconnect. It’s passed the window to return so it is wasted money. It disconnects all the time due to too many things connected. The ring just made WiFi worse. I got another router which was $100 which barely made any improvements to ring but helped my WiFi somewhat. I bought the ring chime pro which did nothing to boost connection or WiFi for the ring. I cannot move the router/modem any closer and it’s really not that far away. Most of the time it doesn’t pick up anyone outside due to connection. It is hardwired in but that didn’t make a difference.,so after spending all this extra money to make it better, nothing helped. I guess if I buy an upgraded WiFi package but that’s just more money on top of what I already spent. Honestly, I’m ready to return the ring and ring chime pro. I have d-link cameras that work much better and gave night vision. Way cheaper and didn’t require all this extra $ to get it or keep it connected and they are on WiFi only not hard wired.

title: needs much improvement, went bad in 15 days
content: Replaced my ring doorbell 2 with this doorbell 3 at my front door.  Kept the 2, because it's great.  This doorbell 3 is basically a doorbell 2 with supposed new features.  Motion zones are suppose to be better, they really aren't, you actually get a slider in the doorbell 2,this one you can't adjust the range, just unselect generic areas.  You can tell the app how far away from the street you are, but it doesn't make any difference in the app, it still gives you generic ranges, which are exactly the same.  Seems like a step backwards.  The slider on the doorbell 2 with the car symbol was actually really great.  That's gone with this. This is supposed to have "improved wifi."  It really doesn't, in fact it's worse.  My doorbell 2 had an rssi of 48 at my front door, this doorbell 3, with the same router in the same location, and doorbell mounted in the same spot, has a worse signal, with an rssi of 71... My router is 10 feet from this.... Unless Ring improves the firmware and takes advantage of the features, this is really nothing new and special, it's a repackaged doorbell 2. Picture quality is great, same as the doorbell 2, no difference.  Motion detection is basically the same, after testing it upon install. I'm keeping this in hopes they improve the firmware and app software, otherwise I would have tried finding a discounted doorbell 2. ** called support about the terrible wifi, they had no answer other than suggesting an extender... For a doorbell 10 feet from the router.... **update, after owning this for 15 days, the audio microphone now stopped working properly.  Some times no audio, and sometimes choppy.  I swear, I got a defective unit from the start, sending back for a replacement.

title: Undecided
content: At this point, I'm undecided as to how I feel about the Ring video doorbell. If I set it to pick up human movement only, it sends a 'movement at front door' message is a car drives by a couple hundred feet away while not even noticing if I go outside and stand in front of the doorbell.  If I switch it back to monitor all movement, it's messaging every time a bird flies by, a car drives by and sometimes we can't even figure out what it sees at all.  So it seems to be a choice between wearing out the batteries of both the doorbell & my phone along with getting messages about someone driving down the street 500 ft away... OR not know when someone is standing in front of our door.

title: After your 30 day free trial, you must purchase a yearly plan through Ring to view your recordings
content: The product itself works great, the problem lies with the Ring service itself. A word of caution to those looking to buy a Ring video doorbell: When you first set up a new device, you get 30 days free of video recording. After the 30 days is up, you can no longer view any video recordings triggered by the motion activation on your video doorbell *unless* you purchase a "Ring Protect Plan" through Ring.  The cheapest subscription is $30/year that works for *one* device. The other plan is $100/year that works with all devices. You can still view the live feed of your video doorbell, and it still functions normally, however, unless you purchase a plan you can no longer view any recordings that your device makes.  In my opinion, considering how much you pay for the product, it's obnoxious you have to pay a subscription fee to view 20 second recordings.  Be warned.

author: Michael Allen

title: Returning the product, motion detection and network issues
content: i would not recommend this product, to anyone. The motion detection leaves a lot to be desired. I've messed around with the settings, sensitives, zones, "smart" detection, etc. and nothing seems to work. The Ring will pick up passing vehicles 40+ feet away, but not pickup the USPS worker dropping the package off on my porch. Also if i enter or leave either side of my house (which is within the supposed range/zones of the Ring), it does not pickup the motion. I do have 3 step up to my porch and installed the wedge to angle it downward. I've also tried it without the wedge and there was no notable difference. Lastly, the network connectivity is spotty at best. I'll often get delayed/no alerts or i'll have videos stuck in "processing." It's not my Internet, i have an Orbi mesh-network with 300mbps speeds. No devices in my household have any issue with internet connection, so it has to be the Ring. The night vision and video quality are good, when it works. But if the motion detection isn't working correctly or i can't watch the videos without it taking forever to process, then what good is the video quality? I'll be caulking the 2 screw holes in my vinyl siding and returning the product ASAP.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: scott
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Good enough, but not 'great'
content: There is much to like about this doorbell. It does what it needs to do as a smart doorbell and the picture quality is decent. It attaches to my Alexa dot (as a chime and answering device) so that is also a plus. So what are its downfalls? #1. The sound is abysmal. It simply isn't loud enough for people to hear you well.  I actually use my porch Echo Dot to 'drop in' and speak to people, since this doorbell is so depressingly low in output noise. THIS IS A BIG PROBLEM.  It is noisy on my street, and it renders communication useless by itself. #2. You have to pay for a subscription to have it save video of motion and rings. Utterly ridiculous. You should be able to have it save the videos to your phone, cloud of your choice, etc. Forcing a subscription for something that should be standard is tacky. #3. Minor, but you should be able to change the 'light' on a wired Ring. You should be able to have it on or off, and possibly even have a phone operated 'dimmer'. How is this missing on such an expensive ringer? Anyway, I like it well enough, but I think I would go with a different doorbell if I was doing it again.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Great Doorbell and Great Customer Support from Ring
content: UPDATED UPDATE: Other than freezing when I attempt to answer a ring, the doorbell has worked fine. The main reason I wanted it was to know when my mail came and when packages were delivered. I have the chime that goes DING DONG when there's motion. That has worked fine until today. I was waiting, waiting, waiting for two packages to be delivered. No ring from the chime. Finally, I looked online and the packages had been delivered an hour ago. I opened the door to get them, and no ring sounded at my motion. Two little red lights were flashing on both sides of the doorbell button. When I rang the doorbell, those lights when out, and now it seems to be working fine. I have no clue why it didn't get the delivery. No ring, no picture. Nothing. I've had mine since April. I didn't expect it to stop working after only 7 months. UPDATED REVIEW : I'm changing my rating because of the incredible support I got from Ring. Luis advised me to get the Ring Chime Pro Wi-Fi Extender. I did. He helped me connect my Ring Doorbell 3 to the Chime Pro Network and connect the Chime Pro, which helped with my Internet connection. Now, my videos are playing fine and not freezing. Anyone who has connection problems should try the Chime Pro Wi-Fi Extender. ORIGINAL REVIEW: I bought this Ring Doorbell 3 because it got a top rating at CNET. I had an electrician install it yesterday and hardwire it. It worked fine yesterday afternoon and this morning. Now, every time I get a motion notification and open it, it says it's trying to connect. Then when the video opens, it freezes. The bar is still moving,  but there is no movement. People in the frame are frozen. No motion.

title: Disappointing
content: Got our Ring 3 today. We've always wanted one and after all the great reviews on the 2 we figured the 3 would be even better. Our battery makes no good contact to the base. So our power is intermittent at best. We called the support before they closed and were given some 'hacks' and still nothing is working. We got a faulty product. We'll be calling in the morning and asking for another unit. From what LITTLE (Very little few moments) we could get it working the picture quality is superb. Now we just need it to actually work. Also the person we talked to with Ring for a good 40 minutes tonight? Totally blew us off and told my husband 'oh it will be alright' but my husband is a tinkerer. If he says there's a battery connection error he knows what he's talking about. Hopefully tomorrow someone will listen June 12 Update: They are sending us a new Ring Doorbell. It will take 5 business days to get here. June 25th Update: When it works it's really good. The image is good and the sound quality is ok. The battery? Is not gonna last as long as they claim. Also the phone notifications are spotty as is the live feed even if you have a wifi extender. I think a lot of these issues are a poorly updated app vs anything else. I get a lot of black boxes between my feed as snapshot stopped working on day 2. So I took off the snapshot feature. Now it will capture video great. But notifications and live feed are spotty at best. Btw my wifi is fantastic and my cheap $30 Chinese security camera has never had issues like these So I've upgraded this from 2 stars to 3 and if they ever fix the issues I'll update it again.

title: Dishonest advertisement !

title: Expensive, Subscription Required, Poor Connection
content: I used to be a big fan of Ring, but it went from a small company, to another subscription scam. I purchased a Ring for my parents after having a Ring doorbell myself for many years. Because I had done some beta testing, I have had free video storage. The issue is that it has incredible difficulty connecting to the WiFi. My parents router is right in the other room AND I bought them the chime with WiFi extender and they still cannot connect live to see who is at the door. If they want to see who is at the door, they have to watch the video after it has processed which requires spending MORE money on a subscription. I would completely understand charging people if they’d like to keep the videos for 24+ hours, but you can’t even view what happened 1 minute ago without paying So, to reiterate, the Ring barely connects, and if you try to see the video a moment later after it processes, you have to pay for a subscription. On top of the $$$ you spent on the doorbell. So here ends my recommendation of Ring to anyone. I’m embarrassed I purchased one for my parents and will be returning it. The doorbell is expensive, the subscription model is poor, and the connection is subpar.

title: Misses important events. Thieves must laugh.
content: Update: I returned it. In a 22 minute span this morning it missed me driving in, missed two trash trucks go by, missed me walking up to it twice. And just now missed an Amazon delivery.  Thankful for Amazon return policy. ... I'm so disappointed. This captures every car that goes by, but just today missed the mail carrier (who was in view of the camera as she walked up the driveway and then stood in front of the ring doorbell to deliver the mail); captured me driving onto my driveway but missed me walking to the front door or standing there to unlock it (again, had to walk in front of the doorbell to do that).  It did catch the UPS delivery guy at the door, but not his truck as he pulled up. Burglars and package thieves have little to fear! Pretty low random chance of being seen. I called the Ring helpline a few days ago. The very pleasant woman took me through adjusting some of the settings but, as you can judge from today, it really didn't help. I wish I'd never bought this thing.

title: WIFI issues and more make this one useless
content: I've had the original Ring for 2 years or so. It worked and rarely lost signal. The big issue was that you had to remove the Ring from your door to charge it, which would have to be done at least once a week or more often, depending on the motion setting. I purchased the solar charger, which was very hit and miss. The lower resolution compared to the Ring 3 wasn't great, but it was sufficient. So I was excited when Ring announced the supposedly improved Ring 3 Pro. I love that Ring 3 Pro now has a replaceable battery - when it's low, you take out just the battery pack and charge that separately, and you keep the Ring screwed on to your door. Nice. I also liked the increased resolution - at least on paper. In practice, it doesn't really matter. The HUGE issue and deal killer is that after a month of successfully using the Ring 3 Pro, I can now no longer connect to Wifi. It would drop and not reconnect. So I un-paired the device, and then went through the entire setup process. And again. And again. And again. It never worked, even though the router is in the exact same position, has the same signal strength and there are no new barriers between the router and the Ring 3, I can no longer connect the device to the router, making it useless. Ring in general is full of compromises but you can live with them - but not when it can't connect to your Wifi, which is the way this thing works ( unless you opt for the hardwired option which isn't possible for many of us.) When the Ring 3 Pro did work (first month), I didn't like that it took more than twice the time to connect and ring on my connected devices. For example, when someone rang my old Ring 1 doorbell, it took about 2 seconds until I got the notification on my iPad and phones. With the Ring 3 Pro, it took about 10 seconds. That's bad, but I could live with it. But now it's not working AT ALL, because of the Wifi issue. And judging by the other reviews here, I'm not alone. Other issues: night vision motion trigger is hit and miss, but this may be to the confusing motion settings. The quality of night vision itself is very good (when it worked) . This leads me to the motion settings which are...odd. You can narrow down what triggers motion, and when. Want only people to trigger a motion alert? There's an option for that. Except it doesn't work properly. It missed UPS, FedEx and Amazon delivery persons numerous times, and those guys were right at the door. It's a bad product, plain and simple. It's overpriced for what it does, and buggy. For a big company - owned by one of THE biggest tech companies on earth: Amazon -  this shouldn't be the case. It's too late to return this item now so I'm stuck with a $200 dollar dummy camera on my door. Not recommended, unfortunately.

title: Battery does not last as advertised.

title: Reliable (don’t expect to be wowed)
content: Overall it’s a great product and what you expect from Ring/Amazon. The picture quality is good and and the motion detection has been very impressive compared to the Ring 1 that I just upgraded from. The Cons: 1.) integration with Alexa- the live video display on your show devices takes long...like you might as well just open the door and find out who it is before waiting forever for the video to show if it does at all. 2.) Upgrading from a previous Ring- if you’re upgrading from a Ring 1 like I did, be aware that the design of this mounting bracket is going to give you a headache. You would think the drilling holes to mount the bracket would remain in the same place as the old version since the device is the same size...wrong. You will have to caulk and re-drill new holes for this bracket. Pros: Faceplate- the two faceplates that ship with the device (basic silver and oil rubbed bronze) are a nice option to match the outdoor aesthetic Apartment living- I live in an apartment with no existing door bell. If you have a ring and your home has Alexa devices they will act as a doorbell chime when the button is pressed. This is very nice and eliminates the need for a Ring Chime. In addition, through IFTTT and Phillips Hue you can actually select to have certain (or all) lights in your home blink in addition to the chime. I LOVE this feature for on my outdoor patio to see the lights blink and know someone is at my door. All in all it’s a great product. If you’re looking to upgrade from a previous Ring I’d suggest wait for a better release because this won’t blow your socks off. But if you can get it for a good deal, (I.e. trade in special) it might be worth considering.

title: Battery runs out even when it is hardwired
content: I have the doorbell hard-wired and have put the settings so that it records a lot. In that configuration, it drains the battery. I was under the impression that it should not need the battery when hardwired. That does not seem to be the case. The Support team is quite unclear about how it is supposed to work and to debug the issue. They are not able to connect the dots... but just recommend that I reduce the number of recordings. I don't want to spend more time with trial and error and plan to return it soon :-( Later update: On working with Ring specialized support team (they are great!), I learned that the hardwired Ring Video Doorbell 3+ does not actually use the wired power to run its operations. It relies on the battery for that. The trickle charge the Ring Video Doorbell 3+ gets from being hardwired is solely used to charge the battery. When there are a large amount of events (over 30-40/day), the battery may drain faster than it receives in the trickle charge. I had a lot of events and hence it was running into this problem. In that case, Ring Video Doorbell Pro works better as it actually uses wired power to run its operations and hence does not have a limit on the amount of events or recording it can support. So that is the right product for my situation. As such, I returned this and bought Doorbell Pro a few days ago and that has been working well. My suggestion to Ring: Given so many Ring Doorbell products, it should consider providing a better comparison on the website to allow users to pick the right product for their needs.

title: Wow....super easy😁✔
content: I am new to the "ring" system and had no idea what to do and so on. Got item in a timely manner as usual (Thanks Amazon), and right away got things in motion. Instructions are spot on and super easy to follow. PLEASE NOTE: Make sure you enable your "Location" on mobile device which you use to activate/set up ALL your "ring" gadgets.....you'll thank me for it later 🤗 Picture is crystal clear and it detects what you tell it to via settings. This is so simple to install, a 10 year old can do it. Night vision is great and once you decide where and how to mount it, you are all set and have a lot more peace of mind. I did not follow the recommendation of 4 feet height bc I felt I got better coverage and wider view at 5 feet. Since I am 5'3" tall,  or, funsized as I like to call it🤗, I just wanted it to be a little lower than my height...not many folks are shorter than me 🤣, so placing it higher actually works perfectly for me, but, play around with it and see what suits you best. You get a 30 day trial (free service) and after that it's up to you which ring plan you want. Installation took about 10 minutes from unboxing to live view, and you get everything you need to mount/install , no need to run to the hardware store for ankers or screws ! They really made this dummy proof....and if I can mount/install this, than anybody can! Battery has long life, but I bought a spare battery, bc I bought another doorbell for my back door, so, while 1 is charging neither will be down. That's about all I got for you on this item.

title: Stay away from this.
content: *Update added* So far, I'm not very impressed. I installed this, after charging the battery. I went outside, it seemed to work and notified me I was there. Cool. Then, I had some other packages delivered from other websites besides Amazon, and it did not notify me. They delivered the package not even 4 feet to the right of the ring. Going to my "premium trial recorded video" on the app, it just randomly appears, after it skips 15 seconds. No parked vehicles shown, no one walking, etc. Okay... We all have small issues. Last night, when it went from daylight, to night, it literally goes from bright outside, skips 15 or so seconds, and then it's somehow dark dark night. It doesn't show transition, it just goes from 5:40pm bright, to 5:41pm or something, dark black night. I get home today, and same thing, it doesn't register that I'm there, it doesn't register my truck pulling in, or me walking up to the front door. It doesn't work, and if it continues this, I'll have to return it within the time frame allotted from amazon. I'm kind of annoyed that this thing was nearly $200, and has so many issues within the first day or two. *Update 9/8/20* Following my previous posting of this review, I received an e-mail from a representative from Ring at 12:32pm, apparently I did not answer fast enough, and she messaged again 1:39pm, with a quote of the previous message in it the new e-mail. I responded and told her I would get back to her when I had free time due to running my company. The response was that she did not mean to send another e-mail, (remember, she had quoted the previous message, so this seemed odd.) After 3 days of me not messaging to have her tell me what I had already figured out from the instructions when I first installed it to begin with, she messaged again to get in contact, and eventually closed the report 2 days after that. I did not contact them during this period, in full disclosure. Today is the first day my 'trial' period is over, and I cannot access my ring. I cannot use it for live video, and literally everything is setting it off. It seems like as soon as your trial period is over, they reset all of the previous settings and do not allow for any usage of a nearly $200 piece of equipment. This is absolutely ridiculous, and I HIGHLY suggest everyone stay away from it unless you are willing to constantly pay a monthly fee just to use it, even at the most basic of functions advertised. This hunk of excrement would have been returned if I had not had the high hopes, and already thrown away the box it came in. Waste of money.

title: Kind of cool expensive doorbell with technical issues (*UPDATED +2 star for Technical Support)
content: UPDATE 7/25/2020 Just wanted to add that Tech Support is pretty good. *TL;DR? 6/23/2020 - Ring Support Updated the Firmware *3-Battery Drain: Firmware Update 6/23 Resolved 7/25 Still have not needed to swap out the battery. *4-Motion Detection: 6/23 Firmware & Optimized Motion Settings by Tech Support 7/25 Motion detection is still an issue for me due to delayed response. *5-WiFi: Firmware & 2.4G instead of 5G - 6/23 2.4G works better than 5G and appears to be resolved. 6/23 UPDATE: After only 4 days had to replace the battery again so called Ring Support. After a brief conversation with Daniel I felt reassured on 3 issues I noted below and will provide another update after some time has passed. Daniel was very polite and patient walking me through settings and remained on the phone for 45+ minutes. SmartHome integration has been slow for us and the Ring Doorbell 3 was a nice addition. Pro: Arrived as expected and packaging was hassle free and easy to unbox. Installation and setup was easy for me. Came with necessary tools plus some extra hardware I didn't need. Alexa integration and notifications are good. e.g., I like having the announcement "Motion detected at your front door", when it works. Video quality is very good, when it records. The Android App has some good features. I like having the announcement when I'm away. Note: I had originally purchased Ring Doorbell 2 from BestBuy and promptly returned it due to poor wireless connectivity, even with an extender 1 wall and 10 feet away, and reasons below. My hope was V3 would be worth the extra money. The added 5G support made some improvement but overall a disappointment. Con: First - The Price Tag. Just my opinion but seems way overpriced when compared to other IP cameras that are half the price or less that have local SD card storage. Sure, Ring offers some extra bells and whistles and 'cloud' storage but after the wow factor wears off probably won't think about them again. Not sure what I was thinking but I could have bought a complete 4 camera surveillance system with 1TB storage for the price of a Ring Doorbell 3, when not on sale. Second - The lack of industry streaming options like RTSP, even as part of the paid subscription, is a big miss. I do have other cams ($25ea) setup on my server monitor that support RTSP. *Third - Battery Drain while hardwired *UPDATE: Ring support updated the firmware which 'should' address battery drain problem. *Fourth - Motion detection is unreliable. After several attempts at Ring Wizardry it still detects cars on the street better than the Amazon guy walking up to my porch. In other words, a person can run up to the doorbell and not be detected. *UPDATE: Ring support walked me through changing some settings and also updated the firmware. *Fifth - Wireless support is better than V2 but still seems to be weak. My Netgear router extender is a standard wood frame outside wall and 10 feet away and I only get RSSI of 67. One would think something designed to work outside should work better outside. I have Wyze Cams that are 2x farther from the extender separated by 2nd floor structure. *UPDATE: Ring support updated the firmware which 'should' improve wireless and also advised on using 2.4G instead of 5G because it will work better through walls. Testing confirmed that I now get RSSI-51 instead of RSSI-65-70 (note that the lower RSSI number the better). Sixth - A subscription is only $30 a year but the fact that one is even required is a bit much to ask and one reason I almost didn't get Ring Doorbell 3. Even with a sub you only get 60 days playback. Having videos stored in the ever ubiquitous cloud is why no other Ring Cam device will be used here.

title: Easy Setup, User Friendly App & Good Quality Video
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I bought the Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus a month ago and my husband thinks it's the greatest invention ever made!  The day after I set it up he was at Home Depot shopping when he got the alarm from his phone that someone was at the door.  He pulled up the Ring app on his phone and our fence contractor was on our porch.  He talked to the contractor for a few minutes through the Ring.  He thought it was so cool that he could talk to the fence contractor who was on our front porch while he was in Home Depot! When I first unboxed the ring, the battery power was about 35%.  I was too excited to wait for it to charge so I downloaded the app, inserted the battery, and set it up.  (After setting it up, I charged the battery overnight.)  We never had a real doorbell, just an old-fashioned handle to twist a real bell and thankfully no one uses it anymore because it was so loud, that I would jump every time I heard it.  So, I love the rechargeable battery feature since we had no pre-existing electrical doorbell.  We bought a second battery a couple of weeks ago.  The battery says that it can last up to six months depending on your settings but we had to replace it after three weeks, but to be fair we did a lot of playing with it those first weeks. If you own one Ring video device there is a subscription of $3 per month and if you have two or more it's $10 per month.  So that means you can record, store, share, and view events whenever you want. After finding just the right spot for it I was able to set it up easily.  I was a little nervous because I did a lot of research about the Ring and mesh systems and there seemed to be a problem with the two being compatible but it flawlessly integrated into our new mesh system so that must be a problem of the past that no longer exists. At first, we were getting a lot of unwanted alerts so I went to settings then opened the motion wizard, and answered a few questions that seemed to help somewhat. what really helped was going into the motion zones and tweaking those.  I turned off the outer three zones of the yard and left on the ones that were closest to the house as well as turned down the motion sensitivity.  On almost every screen, there is a button marked "live view" so no matter what you're doing you can easily switch to a live view of your yard.  They also added a wedge with the setup kit to use if your front door is on a hill or upstairs so that it tilts the doorbell to make the camera angle just right. If you watch the video I posted, it's of a UPS driver dropping off a package.  Because of the motion sensitivity alert, I knew he was there before he rang the bell.  We didn't get the Ring Chime because we have 3 Alexa devices in the house that have a large array of doorbell chimes including seasonal ones.  We also have an Alexa Show that my husband took hostage on his bedside table so he can ask Alexa to show us who's at the door.  The Ring app also has quite a few chimes on it as well so you can switch up how your phone alerts you.  I really like the four-second pre-roll.  If you notice my video starts with the black & white pre-roll, and I read that it's black & white to save battery power, and then it turns to color.  I noticed that I could use my thumb and forefinger to make the video bigger so I can even see the expression on my husband's face as he's getting in the car. Another cool feature is once you set up the Ring and the app you are automatically and anonymously become members of a secondary app called "Neighbors."  You can decide how big you want your neighborhood to be.  It defaults to three miles radius around your house, but you can make it bigger or smaller.  It's good for posting videos of any wild animals you see through the Ring, lost animals, of course, you would want to post any crimes.  I saw a posting from my local police force asking if anyone had footage of the 200 block of Main St. on 9/28 between the hours of 5 - 6 p.m. because someone lit a car on fire and they were looking for evidence. I get between eight to ten packages per day because of my business so I am very glad to have the ring and I happily recommend it to everybody! Thank you for reading my review and I hope it helps you with making your purchasing decision!

title: It’s not as good of a product or deal as you think.
content: im seriously pretty disappointed.. I’ve bought two ring cameras and little to my knowledge did I know that you would have to spend an additional $ 100.00 dollars annually for their app to be able to review your previously recorded videos.  What a scam!  So if somebody comes over and gets in your home or is on your property you can not go back and look at it or use it for evidence.  Had I have not thrown the boxes away I would send them back and get something that doesn’t try to rip you off down the road.  Two thumbs Down.  Find a camera that you can buy that doesn’t require additional fees in order to operate.  👎👎.

title: Disappointed

I was just disappointed with the motion detection. It only recorded when someone got close and the only recorded the back of the person leaving. The ads of talking to someone at the door would only happed if the person rang the doorbell. I returned this unit as I was disappointed with its detection even though the picture and color during the day was impressive.

title: Crappy customer service
content: (ORIGINAL RATING: ONE STAR) I got the entire product installed, including having to use sealant to attach properly to EFIS and then the “support” tells me I have to completely redo the process because it set up incorrectly on their end and there is no way to get the necessary codes without having the back of the unit. I’m returning as either support or the product are not ready for prime time. Update Review August 14 (updated STARS based on device and last rep, not first experience): Ring customer service reached out by email in response to my review and set up a time to provide customer service on the device. First, as I discovered after the rep call and as verified by the person from Ring, I did not need to uninstall my installed (and silicone caulked) device in order to re-register it. The codes were on the box and on a slip in the box. Plus, as it turned out, the rep was not familiar with the current security setups (which cannot be bypassed) or with the setup issues since my doorbell did not need to be re-registered. Rather, with the informed and helpful rep, we were able to locate a setting on my Alexa device settings that was turned off an prevented its use as my doorbell. The rep was very polite and helpful. I am now happily using the device and -- about a week in -- it seems to be working well. I wish Ring CS reps were all better informed, but do appreciate the follow up and helpful assistance.

title: Worst Purchase EVER - Don't Buy Unless You Plan to Subscribe
content: So this product worked perfectly until the trial subscription ended.  We only needed the RING doorbell to see who is at our doorstep and to be able to converse with them.  We have other cameras onsite to record and save video.  When we purchased RING, it was super sensitive and was sending notifications to my phone ALL the time for every leaf that blew by.  We adjusted the settings and were happy.  But the settings can only be adjusted to remove extreme sensitivity IF you have a subscription.  All other adjustments won't decrease the sensitivity to a manageable level.  But our biggest issue is that the RING does not work consistently with the app any longer.  If you can't view Live View, you can't chat with the person at your door and this purchase becomes a complete waste of money.  Contacted Tech Support and they recommended reinstalling the app.  We did and it worked for 30 minutes until it refused to show the Live View.  NEVER had any issues when we had the trial subscription.  Do not recommend.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Lackluster results
content: We've been using the Ring Doorbell 3 for the past few days now, and it is very hit or miss (mostly miss). The picture quality is ok, it's actually better at night without the sun glare heavily distorting the camera. But the motion detection, and even more-so the notification timing, leaves a lot to be desired. I've gone through the settings and setup motion zones, tried toggling "People Only Mode" on\off and adjusted the sensitivity rate, and nothing really hits the mark. We often get notifications of motion when nothing is there, a plant shifted in the wind, or a car is driving down the street. However, on 3 occasions now, we've had packages delivered right to our front door.... and nothing from ring. Nothing was recorded, no notification, no anything. Kinda defeats the purpose right? But if I walk out my front door, it will detect that. Also when a legit event is captured, by the time we receive the notification on our phones, the person has already left (such as me walking outside to get the mail, and walking back in before notification hits). Not sure what the deal is, but very unimpressed so far. I also picked up the Ring Chime Pro, and that will be getting returned to Amazon ASAP. Thinking the Ring Doorbell 3 will accompany the Chime on its journey back to the warehouse.

title: This saved us from a home invasion
content: I am so happy to have bought this when I did. a few days prior to installing, I caught someone who appeared to be in the middle of  casing our house. I erred on the side of caution and bought the Ring 3 Plus after doing a little research. The next week we were visited 4 times in the same day by different people at different times and caught it all on video/audio. As it turns out there was a crew across the street ready to take us for everything we had once they identified the opportunity. I have never felt so protected by a piece of technology in my life and am thankful for my purchase. $3/mo for monitoring, person recognition, recording, and a slew of other features. I am happy to do it.

title: The installation instructions were greatly lacking but changed from 1 to 4 stars
content: I already had the 1st Ring, so I understand how it all works -- I even installed the previous one. The instruction book that is EXCELLENT for getting the Ring device up and going, but is limited for actually installing on the wall. It is vague, with pictures, that don't match the device. The GREAT news, I didn't know about is that it comes with a MUCH-NEEDED wedge! I was over the moon, until I realized the difficulty attaching it to the wall. I can attach the wedge to the device -- no problem, but attaching it to the wall is more obscure, as the wires need to be fed through its hole, which would have been useful to show, or at least mention! I eventually discovered that the plastic baggies with tools, have descriptions of what the items are used for. That wasn't readily apparent, but I see it now. It looks like the wedges were a very useful add-on, but not very integrated into the installation process, short of a small 3 inch 3-picture summary sheet. So I have no idea if I'll actually be able to do this. I'll update my review with my results. But I love the wedge! UPDATE: I had to get a neighbor to help me since the installation documentation had lots of issues in its lack of information (a template would be helpful) but we got it done. My Ring generation 1 was slow to respond and I frequently got the backside of someone, IF AT ALL, but when it worked, it was really helpful. The upgrade provided MUCH faster response time and the quality of picture allowed me to zoom in on delivered package labels. Amazing. And the neighborhood notification network, isn't spoken of often enough. It is really helpful. AFTER it was installed, I discovered a welcome email with connections to support, but I'd already passed my level of frustration and also was happy with the final installation. The mounting to the wall is the single biggest issue, so just understand that, and your compatibility or need for adaption not covered in any of the documentation, BUT it's all now worth it. The previous version CONSTANTLY dropped wifi connection, even after a booster being installed within 4 feet, so I'll update if this one does the same thing, but so far, so good.

title: Disappointing; slow, ineffective, rip-off
content: Pros: -easy to install - easy activation - good picture/sound quality. Cons:  everything else - wonky, clunky app (you’d think they’d have a simpler interface) - over sensitive (flag blows In the corner of the range or garbage truck passes 60 feet away and I get a motion detection and recording.. and this is with 3 zones deactivated and sensitivity decreased) - under sensitive (doesn’t register a delivery person placing a package from 4, feet away in the selected zone... but still seeing the flash and garbage truck - delayed notifications (About a quarter of the time I receive notifications of a person 2-3 minutes after the occurrence... this is with a doorbell place within 12 feet of the router and consistent WiFi connection) - recording only for a monthly fee.  So when I get a late notification, I won’t get to respond. In summary, I wanted to like it, really I did!  However, I think I could make as effective security/communication system using my old Radio Shack 101 kit from the 70’s (snap circuits for you younger crowd) or a pair of cheap two way radios with a basic WiFi camera.  I’m returning all three that I just bought because they are a waste of money.  Guess I’ll keep looking.

title: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus useless unless you pay for monthly subscription!
content: I am very disappointed that I have to pay a monthly subscription in order to view my videos that was recorded by my Ring Video Doorbell. In the description, it's indicated that you will need the Ring Protect Plan (subscription sold separately), to record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos. However, what they fail to tell you before purchase is that you will NOT be able to view any of your videos after a 30 day trial unless you pay a monthly fee. What a total rip-off... If I buy a video camera and record a 20 second video clip with it, that video clip should belong to me and I should have the right to save it to my computer or phone and view that video clip as I please. When you buy the Ring Video Doorbell, it becomes your property, and the videos that you record with it should be your property as well... What a total rip-off.

title: FALSE ADVERTISING
content: The product itself works okay.  Not great, but functional. Laggy and slow often, but overall gets the job done. My issue is that almost ALL the features this product advertises in the product description and title itself are PAY TO PLAY features. This is not mentioned anywhere. The first month comes with everything free apparently... but then your trial (you didn't even know you were in) expires. And you lose everything except Live View Mode. You no longer have the pre-roll, you no longer can view who last came to the door... All the helpful advertised features disappear. Very disappointed. Now they want $10 a month to get everything that should have been included from the start. Very disappointed.

title: Not reliable - Too many defective units
content: Often alerts of movement at the front door are delayed by as much as 3 minutes.  Some movements are missed entirely.  It's a nice unit but is not reliable as a security camera.  Also, when 2 alerts come in quick sucession the system gets confused.  The first alert and video of a mailman is fine, but when I go out a few minutes later to get the mail, the video starts out in color and then finishes in black and white, exactly opposite of what should happen.  Also, the verbal announcement comes 5 minutes later. Making me think a new alert has occurred. Also, activating the device is slow and recharging the battery takes much too time.  And because my  front door is in shade and the camera adjusts for that, areas in sunlight are overexposed and images are washed out.  Audio is also very poor, garbled. Unfortunately, Ring is not ready for prime time. Update:  Spent a half hour on the phone with Nicole at Ring support as she tried to solve some of my issues.  (She initiated the call based on my review, so kudos to Ring.)  Turns out that the central exclusion zone turns off only one sensor, but 2 adjacent sensors still pick up activity at the margins and gives unwanted, and supposedly excluded, alerts for passing traffic.  She also sent a list of Android add-on apps that will interfere with Ring - a long list.  But I don't have any of these.  She agreed that the often 5 to 10 minute delay is unacceptable but had no real solution other than to replace the unit with a more expensive security camera.  I told her that I only wanted the Ring to perform as advertised, and since the late notification makes it useless as a warning device, I will be returning the unit. Final update:  Working with Nicole has done nothing to fix my unit, and in fact, as time goes on more problems arise.  Even so, Nicole tells me that I will not be able to receive a replacement!  What kind of customer support is this?  I originally gave Ring 2 stars but that was much too generous.  I've now reduced it to 1 star although 0 stars would be more appropriate.  I can't speak for the many users who are happy with Ring, but I can say that purchasing a Ring Doorbell 3+ is a gamble and I suggest that you don't take the chance.

And apparently a lot of people have good luck with it.  But it has been a dismal experience for me.
