title: Not too bad for non professional, but battery sucks!!
content: Bought this for the front door of the house monitoring. Have been using it for almost a month now. I like it for the most part. Video quality is pretty good but you really have to play with all the settings to find the right detections and still sometimes it doesn't capture all the motions you really need. Sometimes it does not detect a person right in front of the camera or motion. Yet other times it will be so sensitive it will pick up leaves blowing on a tree or a squirrel walking by. The very worst part in my experience is the battery life. It drains super fast especially when you go on live view. I have to switch the battery out for the second time since first being installed. So basically the battery lasts about a week. Definitely invest in a backup battery because it take 6-8 hours to charge. So you waste a day for charging just to last 6-7 more days and do it all over again.. For not being a super high tech type of device, is it worth the price, no I think the price should be lowered due to all of the issues you still deal with. But overall I am not completely dissatisfied, I do like it otherwise and do not regret purchasing it.

title: This thing is AMAZING.
content: We recently bought a Ring 3, and it’s AMAZING. Setup was super easy- the app walks you through every single step. We wired ours in with the old doorbell wires, which was also really easy (the app gives step by step video instructions for that, too). The picture clarity is fantastic, and it was really easy to set the sensitivity and block out areas I wanted the motion detection to ignore, like the tree next to our walk-up. The cars passing by on our street don’t trigger the motion detection alerts, and we can pull in and out of the driveway without triggering the alert. That’s the way we want it- we only want alerts when there is motion on the porch- but it can be easily set to detect motion that far out if you want it to (the default settings were that way, and it worked perfectly). When someone rings the doorbell, it very quickly shows the live feed on our phones, and it’s easy to have a two-way conversation with the person at the door. The app setup also asked me if I wanted to make our old doorbell chime- the one in the house that’s been here for 40+ years- continue to chime as it always has when the Ring doorbell button is pushed. I said I did, the app was like “ok cool, give it a try!” I pushed the Ring doorbell, the old chime chimed (and the alerts popped up and chimed on our phones), and the app said, “did it work?” I said it did, and it said, “great, you’re all set!” (Note: we can use this function because we wired our Ring with the old doorbell wires.) That’s how good the setup instructions are. In a matter of hours we had it wired and mounted and working perfectly to detect the motion we want it to detect for our specific needs. There is essentially no lag time in the feed- maybe the tiniest fraction of a second, but certainly nothing that makes the two-way live talking feature a problem. I’ve had plenty of cell phone conversations with a longer lag than this. The whole system is exactly what we hoped it would be. When I bought the Ring 3 I noticed there was a drop down menu to choose just the Ring 3, or the Ring 3 with a free Echo Show. This seemed crazy to me- I could add an Echo Show and it was the same price as just the Ring 3?- but indeed, that’s exactly what happened! The Echo Show showed up a day before the Ring, which gave me some time to figure out what it can do. It’s far more useful than I imagined it would be, and it works seamlessly with the Ring 3. The second someone rings the doorbell, the live feed appears on the screen. We’ve only had our Ring for a few days, but it’s working flawlessly. We do have a really fast WiFi connection and the router isn’t far from the front door, so maybe that’s part of why it’s working so well for us.

title: This version is excellent!!
content: I had ordered the version 2 from ring itself... Then they backordered it and didn’t inform me... So I cancelled it.. I ordered the version 2 on amazon... (was not happy with the system, it would not connect, kept dropping, and was not happy at all). I decided to try the version 3... Let me tell you, excellent 1. It came in the kit with 2 different mounts 2. Wire extensions 3. Removable battery 4. Faster 5. Didn’t drop yet (knock on wood) I love the clarity and the ease of operation I set up the free account for 30 days, have my daughter and wife access to it... (very easy) Then signed up for the year monitoring... for $30 a year... thats $2.5 a month..., spend that on coffee a day lol The motion is easy to set up, and you have a fair amount of fields, yes I would prefer small fields and more to be able to block out some sections... and keep others, but for what this purpose is... it’s great... Quite happy with the extra piece of mind for the inexpensive price!! (I bought 2 more, one for my parents and one for my sons)

title: 50/50 chance with this camera system
content: Pro: I can talk to the person that’s at my door. I’m able to tell ups/FedEx etc to leave packages at my door instead of their attempt delivery due to nobody being home. Easy install with directions. Nice camera view Con: the camera have a slow catching to motion like, the camera sometimes don’t start recording when people walk up to my door but when they ring the doorbell or make a lot of movement to set off the motion detector. The battery life suck if you always checking the camera. I had to buy a backup battery when the one install goes dead (bad reviews for the solar battery is why i didn’t buy that one). The camera blackout around 2:30am until like 4am. The camera is useless when it’s raining or froggy outside. Pictures are much better during the day Instead of night time. I wish there was a option to move the camera around through the app. 10/5/2020. I hope this is useful to others.

title: Connection issues are tough to look passed...
content: I ordered this strictly to replace my Ring 2 because I wanted the rollback feature due to living in an apartment building. Like everyone says, depending on your situation, it may not be worth the upgrade. Only issues I have is the connection to my Ring 3 Plus is not anywhere near as good as my Ring 2. It performs much slower in the app, and sometimes doesn't queue a live feed at all... Also, almost every night between the hours of 2 am and 5 am, it says "footage not available" for some reason. If you have a Ring product, or thinking about it, I don't need to tell you why this is a big deal. Hopefully this will get fixed in a software update of some kind. Other than the above issues which are tough to look passed, the camera is a big step up. It's much clearer in day/night modes than the Ring 2,  and has a bit more of an aggressive "fish eye" display that I like.

title: Best product ever! Best customer support ever! Ignore all negative reviews!
content: To all the negative reviewers of this wonderful product, listen closely! the only reason you're having trouble is your Wi-Fi signal/positioning of your Wi-Fi modem! All you need to do is call Ring support... they answer in less than a minute, walk you through all your options and they recommend You buy the product from Amazon. So, originally I bought the 2nd generation, but I didn't like removing the whole unit to charge the internal battery. Amazon allowed me to return it and I purchased the 3rd generation +. With five interest-free payment this was the easiest thing I ever did! Now to the unit itself... when I first had trouble I called ring support they were able to diagnose my issues and my problem was Wi-Fi signal. I purchased the ring chime Pro Wi-Fi extender and that fixed the problem almost immediately, except when I added a stick-up cam to the system. The mistake I made was not contacting Xfinity in regards to my internet speed/strength of Wi-Fi signal. Turns out, my Wi-Fi modem was 5 years old and wouldn't take updates anymore! since I rent my modem they sent me their latest model. After another call to Ring support, I connected my outdoor stick up cam directly to my 2.4 gigahertz signal from the new Wi-Fi modem, then moved ring chime Pro Wi-Fi extender closer to the front door camera and Wallah! I have never had better reception, better motion detection and better signal! You naysayers need to be patient and go through the steps with Rng support - they're the best! And Amazon is for allowing me to return whenever I need to! Also, Amazon offering interest-free payments how can you beat that? I'm on a fixed income and it's exactly what I needed in my financial situation. Thank You Amazon!
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Wife loves it

She loves it and played with it in multiple locations for several days before deciding where she wanted it.  She mounted it herself and loves it.  She found a special ring tone on her phone for it and already has it hooked up through Alexa as well.  Not sure how the night vision is on it I haven't tested that but the rest of it is great.  The camera and sound quality are great and the play back feature works great as well.

author: Jerry.T
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: It’s good, it could be much better
content: The pre-roll is one of the most important features because it records what happened before the act, but the video quality is so poor that it’s not really useful for helping for identifying much. I’m sure the reason for the poor quality is to consume battery life, but my Ring is hardwired to the electrical and battery life isn’t an issue. The videos are always stored in the cloud, and I’d like to see a local storage option that provides more options, including constant recording. The Ring is supposed to trigger the existing mechanical doorbell, but I find that it often doesn’t and I’m not sure what the issue could be. The Ring doorbell integrates well with Alexa very well, but as tends to be the case with app driven devices, they load slower than I’d like. For example, I could walk faster from the furthest part of my house to the front door at about the same time the Ring app loads after alerting me. That said, I find the app useful when music or movies are too loud and I can’t hear the bell ring.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Ace
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Overall a good unit, but the battery life...
content: Seems to be good quality and was easy to install and set up.  Finally got the motion settings so it wouldn't detect every single car that went by.  It has a setting to detect only between 5-15 ft, but that actually goes beyond that, so I had to play with the actual detection zones.  There is a decent delay between the time it detects motion to the time I'm notified.  The biggest thing is the battery life.  Doing the math, it's actually losing about 1.4% charge per day, and it's not detecting much at all, maybe just the mailman and UPS guy.  At this rate, it'll only have about 15% charge left in about 60 days (2 months), and that's a far cry from the 6-12 months that Ring tells you it will last (that's unacceptable).  Their tech support told me it's the wifi reception, but I tend to disagree because there's only about 30 ft between my router and the device.  I don't know what Ring bases the 6-12 months on.  Will I keep it ?  Not sure, I'll give it a chance.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only

title: I bought this on a deal with the Echo 5 show

I will not buy ring anymore.. this is BS!  I expected that I could just replace the old one with the new one.. its still in the box.. so no review.. sorry.. If I could have just replaced it on the old bracket then I could tell you something.. this is like android crap.. nothing is compatible !  Every upgrade is a whole new thing !  If Apple ever develops a doorbell camera system I will buy that because they maintain compatibility !  Screw Amazon!

author: LV_Tom
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Expect network setup problems, when working it is good
content: I read the reviews and purchased this anyway.  I have wanted this product for sometime so I took a chance. I have a background in IT and work in IT.  I spend several hours trying to get this to connect to my Orbi network, which has 29 other devices connected to it, all working just fine. After about three hours I managed to get it connected so that Live view would show up.  After I installed it on my door frame, I lost the Live view even though the device reported it was online and the signal strength was excellent. This is but one part of the frustration and indicated how worthless a device self check is. I read the work arounds for connecting to Orbi but I am not going to alter my network to make one device work. When the Ring Chime was delivered, configured and installed, the doorbell started working.  I was going to buy the Chime anyway but I am puzzled about why this now works since they are all still on my Orbi network. If you intend to purchase both you may be fine but the doorbell itself could be a problem. Now that it has been working for a few days, it is a good product, the Live view still takes a long time to appear occasionally but it works.  The events, recordings and the logs are very nice.  I like the neighborhood notifications and I would like to add more products if they will stay properly connected.  If not, they will be returned immediately.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: beshannonphotos
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Great Investment
content: The delay is a little slow before the video is activated.  The nighttime video is OK but not great.  However, overall, I am really happy with this purchase and feel more secure.  I love seeing what else is going on in the neighborhood - porch thieves, people rummaging through unlocked cars, even one car theft, bobcats, and mountain lions wandering through people's yard at night (don't leave your small pets outside).  Once a week, I get a report of crimes reported to the Police. I did get an alarm of motion at my front door while I was away.  Unfortunately, I was in an area with poor reception with one cell, I could not view until I got into an area with better cell coverage. I've recommended to several friends. The installation was super simple and packed beautifully with everything you need, even the screwdriver.  I did put one screw in by hand but drilled the other three holes with an electric drill which was much easier on my hand.  I highly recommend.

title: Kind of big
content: I really wanted to use the Ring Video Doorbell Pro but I found out the wiring to my old doorbell was not intact and I could not run new wires from the transformer to the outside in an easy, un-noticeable manner.  So, I did the next best thing and bought this model which has many of the same features but can be battery operated instead of hard-wired.  This device is larger due to the battery but when paired with the angle base (so the doorbell camera can get better videos) it winds up being quite a "block" on the side of my door frame.  The doorbell seems to work well but I haven't gotten the motion-sensing dialed in yet because it still reports street movement when large vehicles pass the house despite my tweaking the settings.

author: Sego

title: So far I am pleased!
content: Setup is pretty easy and intuitive. Preparation was a little harder for a hard wired operation. I ran number 18 transformer/ thermostat wire from  a 24 volt transformer to the doorbell site. The existing wire was too small and brittle. This device battery  will trickle charge from wired connections. I purchased two chimes as well, but the doorbell can use standard 24 volt chimes if they are hard  wired so I have both in service. The app has a lot of features and controls you can use to customize operation. Some quibbles and suggestions are : 1. The mounting block is universal ,not necessarily meant for siding with 4 inch reveal. I glued a small wood block to their mount to support and “locate” it at the bottom end. 2. The bubble level is basically useless If you use their mounting block, as you need to get the mounting block level and plumb. There is no adjustability to the doorbell itself in that case. It would have been helpful to have a horizontal slotting in the mounting block rather than  vertical. 3. Motion sensitivity can be adjusted auto or manually. I tried both. Ways but it does pick up some motion more than 30 feet away. My driveway is 60 feet long. My neighbors driveway across the street rises as does mine so the doorbell picks up their vehicles moving if they are near the top of their driveway. The same for large delivery trucks like UPS. You can’t limit distance but you can adjust sensitivity with a slider  so I am experimenting with that. 4. If going totally wireless, buy a seconded batter as the recharge time is over five hours.

title: Answering The Doorbell On Your Phone Is An Awkward Process!
content: I purchased a Ring Video Doorbell 3 and a Chime Pro about two weeks ago. I had some problems with the installation and wound up returning my original devices to exchange for new ones. I finally got them installed and working properly. Initially, I was pleased with the operation of the doorbell and chime until someone pressed the doorbell button and I went crazy trying to figure out how to answer the doorbell with my phone. It is a very awkward procedure to answer the doorbell. I have to: 1. Unlock my phone, (and, sometimes my phone is in my pocket which is an extra step), 2. Start Ring app, 3. Activate and wait for Live View to start, and finally, 4. Turn on the speaker & microphone to talk to and listen to whoever is at the door. Ring needs to update its software so we can answer the doorbell as easily as we answer an incoming call on our phone. I don't recommend the Ring unless you really need the features it offers AND you are willing to jump through hoops to answer the doorbell!

I am dependent on battery power. I purchased a solar charger additionally  to help extend the battery life. My battery dies in a matter of hours. It almost last as long as it takes to charge. Obviously if there is no power the device does not work as intended. I have tried my best to reach out to customer service using the app. The options do not provide assistance for anything other then versions of getting help with buying new accessories for the existing system and has wait times to speak to someone over an hour. Do not purchase this product unless you can hard wire it to power.

author: ALAN G
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Needs at least 2Mbps  upload speed, minimum.
content: I was having trouble with my first Ring Doorbell 3. The audio on our unit was broken up and choppy. I spent a week trying ALL of the recommended solutions I could find, nothing worked. I then requested a replacement unit which arrived in one day. I do appreciate the great Amazon service. However the 2and unit was experiencing the same audio problem. I came to the conclusion that my in house internet speed was the problem. I had the service tech come out and tested our entire system. We discovered that our internet speed, which is supposed to be 25mbps download and 2mbps upload and is the highest speed that At&T offers, is actually 20.63mbps download and 1.63mbps upload. The recommended upload speed for the Ring Doorbell 3 is 2mbps. After trying the unit on my Phone's Hotspot which is way above these speeds it worked fine. Sadly we are unable to get any higher speed from our home service because we are 1 mile away from the main hook up box for our internet. So due to these circumstances we were unable to use this unit. I highly recommend you check your internet speeds prior to ordering this Ring Doorbell 3 unit. We have since tried a different brand which is working fine with our system.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Mustang Papa
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Love it! 2020
content: I read reviews EVERYWHERE and considered other products bc reviews are up and down.  But there’s a reason why everyone has the ring.  The ring doorbell 3 was so so easy to install.  I got it bc of the easy removable rechargeable battery bc I was planning not to wire install with existing chime.  However, after looking at the ring video tutorials on YouTube, it looked pretty easy and simple.  And guess what???  It was EASY and not scary at all!  Didn’t even need my husband’s help. I am so proud of myself! Installed it over stucco using the provided corner mount kit since my original chime is a bit far from my door.  But the video has a WIDE angle view so I can see everything even if the ring isn’t installed next to my door.  Additionally, I have two large brick columns on my porch that I was afraid would impact the view.  Nope.  Not a problem at all.  The wide angle is so good.  Video quality is good.  I set the video to only screen people so that I’m not getting a notification for every car that passes by. Note on existing chime: at first it didn’t work when I pressed on the ring button.  Thought oh great, will need husband to look at it.  Nope.  You just need to set it up on the Ring app under Device Settings, in-home chime settings, advanced settings.  Since my original chime was a mechanical “ding dong” sound, the instructions tell you to choose “mechanical” chime.  It worked and super easy!

author: Justin

title: Decent video doorbell that you'll have to pay a monthly fee for
content: Functionally the doorbell works fine. It rings in your house (if you hook it up) and on your phone/smart devices. If you want to video with someone at the door, though, it's realistically too slow to do that. By the time you get the app opened and Ring connects to the door camera a normal person would be long gone. The motion detection is pretty hit or miss, too. You can fiddle with it for days and it'll still pick up things you don't want it to while seemingly ignoring human beings unless they're very close. Mine picks up cars fifty feet away but won't catch someone on my sidewalk. This is after working with all of the settings numerous times. The worst part, though, is that you're roped into paying for a subscription if you want the features that people actually use these cameras for - recording video triggered by motion or the doorbell. If you don't pay the monthly fee NO video is recorded. Which renders the Ring basically useless due to how slow it is to bring up a feed when motion/ring are detected.

title: You get $150 worth. Do not expect more...
content: I was looking for solution for the front door and there are not many options unless you want to drill holes in your house and run cable. The setup of this product is easy and anybody can do it. You have to really drill down in the menus to find the functions to define your motion detection zones. My biggest beef with this product is that no matter what the setting is, the first 5-6 seconds are choppy, pixelated b/w video with no merit. I understand that an ultra-wide lens cannot produce forensic details edge to edge, but I am also strongly convinced, being from the industry, that a few bugs more invested in parts would move the needle significantly. Maybe Ring should consider a premium model for $50-70 more and get a better lens, a better sensor and more buffer on the camera. Ring do you hear me?

title: Poor WiFi sensitivity kills Rng 3+ usefulness.
content: A nice idea, but the WiFi sensitivity is poor. If I hold my iPhone X next to the Ring, I get 35 Mbps down and 6 Mbps up. My Ring 3+ reports poor Internet and take over a minute to connect to the Ring app on my iPhone. Once it does the video is jerky and audio breaks up. The distance from my WAP (wireless access point) to the Ring 3+ is about 20’ through a glass and wood door. The reported RSSI is -71dB and evening moving the Ring 3+ next to the WAP only gets me to -63 dB. I plan to contact customer service, but it seems to me the antenna was either left off or is totally inadequate. If there was good WiFi sensitivity, this might be a very good device.

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Happy with this!
content: I am happy with this purchase. You know what’s going on without having to physically monitor your front door. You get audio as well and can communicate too. For the most part it takes great video and you see well even at night without having to leave your lights on. Gone are the days I have to check on amazon to see if my package was delivered. You get instant notification with this when delivered to your door. You can also set sensitivity so it will either take just people at your front door or a larger area around your door. When I put it on sensitive it picks up cars, people, bikes around the area (which again you can set). When you get a notification it can take a few seconds to get live feed. I typically check after the video has been uploaded in history if it’s not urgent. It takes a minute or two to access recently recorded videos in your history. Which is why if I’m eager I click to view live to see what’s going on.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: CC✨👩🏻‍🍳✨
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Easy setup, expected better image quality & WiFi performance
content: Setup was very easy.  Out of the box, charge the battery (arrived with approx. 20% charge - got to 100% in about 4 hours) and install.  Download the Ring app and set up the device.  You can link your Ring to your Amazon account so that you get alerts from your Alexa devices, including visuals if you have a Show device. I'll say I expected a bit more quality.  Obviously not expecting 4K here, but it's far from 1080p picture quality (even with HDR enabled).  Also, I live in an apartment with a metal door - not a heavy thick door but is metal and not wood.  Although my WiFi reaches to the front door (my Fios gateway is less than 20 feet from my front door), once the door closed, the RSSI immediately dipped to -65 or worse, resulting in few to no alerts when motion was detected or when the bell was rung.  I subsequently had to buy a WiFi extender and install it at a mid-point to get the RSSI in to the 40s.  Since installing, I get prompt motion/doorbell alerts on all my devices (Alexas, phones, and my Apple Watch).  Not sure how "enhanced" the "enhanced WiFi" advertised is, but this ultimately ended up requiring a second purchase to boost the signal. I purchased this as part of the Ring/Echo Show 5 bundle Amazon had.  To get both devices for $150 is a great deal.  I would've been happier if the enhanced WiFi was enhanced enough to not require a boost and more money spent, but I'll let that go. Overall, I am satisfied with the device.  Easy (enough) installation and setup.  Would've liked somewhat better quality to identify people, and don't think the enhanced WiFi is all that enhanced.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: mike
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Great Product - Install could use some improvements
content: I love the product so far, but the install did not go well for brick. It would be much better had there been a paper drill bit template, possibly with a level, to make drilling the pilot holes easier. Also, the drill bit did very poorly on brick. It would have made much more sense to include both a wood and a masonry bit, or simply instruct the owner to buy a 7/32 masonry bit if you are installing on masonry. I included a picture of the bit I bought for about $5 and the condition of the bit that comes in the kit after 2.5 arduous holes. Sparks were flying from the Ring bit when I gave up on it. Also, mine is not quite level because the drill bit tends to drift on brick. The bit I bought cut through it like it was butter.  As I said, everything else seems great so far. I may go for more cameras after I've had this for awhile.

title: Vastly improved
content: My Ring video doorbell 2 stopped transmitting unexpectedly-I returned it with no problem.  I was given a credit which I applied to the newer Ring video doorbell 3.  Installation as with the 2 was quick and easy-but the real news is the improvement in all parameters! It connects quickly and easily to my Apple devices; the picture and sound quality is excellent; and a few of the newer features such as a few seconds of video before the motion detectors sound off about a disturbance is neat. The real news for me though is the WiFi connectivity improvement!  The 2 would sometimes take 20 seconds to connect - not desirable for a front doorbell.  The 3 connects in a few seconds and as mentioned picture and sound are very good. Not sure why my 2 stopped working but I am glad I upgraded!

title: HORRIBLE Install Support & App Malfunction
content: Three Problems with this product within first TWO WEEKS! 1) Horrible installation support:  The advertising for this device touts it's quick installation.  This might be the case IF it came with a proper manual, but it does not. Just as one example of a problem:  it comes with a hodge podge of screws of different lengths (3 long screws, 3 medium and 5 short screws) but there were no Security Screws for the Faceplate.  (Even though it was installers using the wrong screw to secure the faceplate that apparently triggered fires with the Ring Doorbell  When I called for installation support with a fairly simple question (precisely which screw might work as the "security screw") I was put on hold repeatedly for the agent to check.  At one point, she actually suggested I get on YouTube and just watch videos. She didn't direct me to the Ring website, she said "YouTube".  She was polite but her English was not great and she absolutely didn’t know the product. 2) App Malfunction the day before THANKSGIVING.  My Ring was hardwired, but then the app suddenly showed it as running on the battery with the battery at “0%”.  Hours later it showed as Hardwired again.  I called Ring support and their outgoing message stated that they were working on the problem.  So, the day before Thanksgiving, when a large proportion of people were traveling, the Ring app was malfunctioning on a wide scale.  WOW! 3) I just happened to identify one instance in which i walked out my front door - right past the Ring device - to check the mail and the Ring didn’t record that event.  But then it did record me walking back in the door.  I have no way of knowing how many other events the Ring may have missed because I don’t have time to keep testing it. At this point, I have no confidence in the device or app and hope that perhaps the sight of the device may discourage porch pirates and potential burglars. In other words, I now view my Ring device as a VERY EXPENSIVE PROP!
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Colin
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: It is slow, slow, slow an you need to pay more
content: I receive a notification about a person being detected, when the person is already right at my door. However, it takes a few more long seconds before Alexa connects to the camera and show me who it is. I'm sure a legitimate guest would grow pretty impatient, and a bad guy may not get deterred enough at these delays. On my Mac, almost half of the time I see message "connection to the camera took more than 10 seconds," and than I don't see anything happening at the door at all. The ring doorbell camera is mostly good to see what has already happened, not what is happening. If you were thinking not to pay for the subscription, think again. The camera is totally useless without a subscription. Did I mention it is slow? So, you only supposed to see live video. When it delayed so much, you don't see that much. However, slowness is not even the biggest problem if you do not have a subscription. By default, the camera produces motion alert for each car passing by. It is so annoying, that I've turned off alerting completely when my trial subscription expired. Then my ring doorbell was not much more useful than a plain old dumb doorbell. With a subscription, you get a new mode of motion detection. It will only alert when an actual person is detected. That removes the annoying car alerts, and only alert when it is useful. However, the person detection makes the detection even slower.

title: HACKED: two stolen packages were *6 INCHES* in front of the Ring camera
content: I had five packages I was returning to Amazon and used the "UPS Pickup" option. * I put them out early this morning, RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE CAMERA. * Just before lunch, two of them were GONE and NO RECORDING OF IT. * See photo for the before and after. * I paid for the "PLUS" monthly service, $30/yr, but today it cost me about $100 in webcam and electronics. * I had MFA turned on and my password was "ja!tw2J3mQ#d". (I've obviously changed it since) * My wifi is hidden, uses WPA2 + AES, and a similar password. * Why do I think it was hacked? Another package was stolen a couple months ago the exact. same. way.

title: Has some flaws
content: While I like this product it has some flaws.  The largest one is the night vision.  It literally is crap on that feature.  I have read all the reviews on the support site of which a lot of people have this issue.  As much as you pay for this item, I would have hoped for a better night feature.  I have other security cams from a different vendor that work immaculately better than ring's. With that said, the daytime photo is perfect at 1080p.  I may have to get the solar option if the battery does not hold out.  In 4 days, I am down to 91% battery where there is no obstructions to set it off all the time and have adjusted the sentisivity.  The mounting brackets are great especially in a tight mounting situation.  I am happy that I got the $60 off deal as I would be even more upset if I paid full price for this.  These are great options if you don't have a wired doorbell to tap into for power.  I am glad however, that I didn't buy two.  The firmware is up to date so I hope they can somehow fix the night vision problem.

title: Stops functioning within 2 weeks
content: I installed the Ring with expectations that it would be a great addition to my house. I expected to be able to get alerts when people were at my door, or see who was ringing the doorbell, etc. Well, within 2 weeks it started lagging and then stopped functioning after I contacted Ring Technical Support. Within 2 weeks the lag got so bad that a delivery person stood in front of the Ring, hit the button to ring the doorbell and finally had to knock on the door because the Ring was so delayed. I confirmed with Ring Technical Support that the wifi signal was strong. I had a neighbor come and get packages off of my porch while I was out of town. What did my Ring show? Packages there 1 minute, and gone the next. There was a total gap in the footage. I rang the bell, walked inside and 5 seconds later the bell went off. Hmmm...not a good doorbell. This is a waste of money and seems to be quite quirky. They obviously have not worked out all the bugs. I think I will return mine and get a traditional doorbell that will actually when the button is pushed.

title: Clearly Check the details on any purchase!
content: First off, I checked out several different models and different makers and I decided to go with the 3-plus. I liked the feature of pre-record. The unit was fairly easy to install, although the trim around the door was not wide enough to mount the doorbell. I had to do some wood working to get it secure. I felt that I would go with a direct power line and use my original chimes. Unfortunately, this didn’t work due to the transformer was not suitable to ring the chimes. So I purchased the ring chimes and set it up (very simple) but the chime was so low and there was no way to make the sound louder. After all that, I returned the ring chime and went out to buy a transformer. I hooked up the new transformer and the original chimes work. My biggest issue is that in order to have the videos, I need to pay for the service plan. After spending appx $250,00, you still need to pay more for a plan which put this unit above the other brands price wise. I’m thinking hard that I’m considering to return  the unit. Frustrated and perplexed for sure.

title: Mobile App com protocol can make the doorbell useless when wired charging does not work
content: I bought this because it has battery AND can be hardwired.  So it would keep the battery changed and work even when power was out. I really like the motion zone settings, sensitivity settings...the fact that you can change whether you want light, standard, or frequent motion detection events, that you can change the length of motion event recordings, and can tell it to take snapshots every N minutes to see things in the area progress throughout the day. But I don't like it when the mobile app will NOT allow me to access the device or provides erroneous information. Several weeks ago, I hardwired the device to doorbell AC wiring per the guidelines provided by Ring.  The device is hardwired, so it should be charging the battery all the time.  But it doesn't.  Or, at least it tells ME it isn't.  After several weeks of futzing with all the newly found online chatter of this known "hardwire will not charge battery" problem, I finally contacted Ring support. Ring Support was easy to get, and very helpful.  Less than 1 minutes once I was in the call queue.  But they are (so far) incapable of letting my Mobile App connect with my device reliably and use its features.  My app accurately says it is hardwired, but it tells me the device is offline with battery at 3%.  Ring Support says the device is online and charged over 90%.  My app won't even contact the Ring servers to attempt to LIVE VIEW the device camera because it thinks the device battery is too low.  The app doesn't even try!  The app assumes it knows the status of the device without actually going out to Ring servers to find out?!  I have verified with Ring Tech Support that my app is properly configured and registered with the correct Ring video doorbell device.  Yet, they can't get the data they have on their servers down to my device, and my device won't attempt to get the data from the servers. Ring Tech Support believes it sometimes just takes hours--up to 24 hours--for the mobile app to synch with the servers.  Well...that means I theoretically have a perfectly functioning video doorbell that I cannot use for hours at a time--sometimes an entire 24-hour day--thru the mobile app.  That is totally unacceptable.  And it proved to be inaccurate. Driving 300 miles round trip to the device I find that their information was not correct.  The device was not online.  It was not connected to wifi.  It had only 24% battery on it.  I had to reset/default to factory settings and go through the setup again to connect it to wifi.  And...the battery is not charging with a live 16vac on the terminals. I've upgraded my review from 1-star to 3-star as they are sending me a replacement Video Doorbell Pro with the defining feature that is not battery powered and requires to be wired.  I lose battery backup, but I clearly wasn't going to get that, anyway.  If the Video Doorbell Pro provides me all the features without issue, I will give that product the 5-stars it might deserve.

author: Bell47
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: New to RING Doorbell Camera.
content: Because our doorbell is at a right-angle to the entry door, I used both of the included offset mountings.  Installed using my cell-phone after loading the application.  The Ring doorbell includes a comprehensive kit with everything you need to install it.  There was also a coupon with the Ring for a custom color cover.  The color choices were horrible so I ordered the mustard color one and painted it to match the beige house, tedious to do but it looks really great. We get instant alerts if someone enters the Camera zone or rings the doorbell but our Show 5" takes around 30 seconds for the image to appear.  This delay is frustrating, especially for the person waiting for us to answer the door.  The video is very good but is distorted due to the Fish-eye Camera lens.  During the day when we are working outside, we turn off the Ring alerts but we still get alerts.  Maybe we are doing something wrong?  We set an alert delay of 4 hours.  Any pointers would be welcome.  Another thing I noticed is the Lithium-Ion battery charging circuit isn't ideal.  Since it's wired to a doorbell circuit, the Ring gets charged up just fine.  What is odd is it charges to 100% and when gets down to 90%, it charges up to 100% again.  This is bad for Lithium-Ion batteries.  They love between a 30% and 90% charge for longevity.  EV owners know this.  Go into "settings" and then "device health" to view the battery status.  Wish they had a firmware update to optimize battery charging.  As it is, they can likely sell more $30 batteries. Overall, this is a good Doorbell Camera.  We already caught a delivery person pounding on our Home's cedar siding, like the Guy was having a tantrum.  Thought he was going to break his hand.  If we would have been home, we would have talked to him to see if he was OK, like mentally stable.  I guess everyone can have a bad day?  He had a Covid-19 facemask on so couldn't identify him but could tell he was NOT an Amazon driver.

title: Why bother
content: Don't fall for it.  The connection between the Ring and the Echo Show is so slow that by the time you see a person at the door, you have already answered it.  The bell works fine, the blue light at night is nice too.  Other than that it's a really expensive waste of time.  I am rarely disappointed by Amazon products but this one has really let me down.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Mark
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Faith restored?
content: This is one of those "great when it works" devices, sadly it almost never works. First off, my area had a couple of micro-power outages recently and ring needed to be completely reset each time. They sell you on the Doorbell 3 being battery powered, but don't warn you that the batteries hate the cold, meaning 1/3 of the US is going to have trouble for 1/3 of the year trying to use this. Had to reset the device again when temperatures dipped. Flat out replaced the battery after the first below freezing night, ring wouldn't connect. Reinstalled the battery, oops, that made it work. There are supposed to be several ways to access it except, depending upon the day, either my Android (phone) or Microsoft (PC) app doesn't work. Thought today was going to be good day when both (!) my Android and Windows apps chimed, except when I tried to activate the camera, a NEW error message - Gateway Timeout. I bought this because my Zoom room/home office is on the second floor of my house, but I've spent more time RE-installing, rebooting, rejiggering this thing - it is a waste of time. Of course, it is installed ON my house now so removing it (and throwing it out) is problematic in and of itself. UPDATE 12/02/20 - Ironically, after the Great Outage of 11/2020, my connection seems much more stable. Notifications via Android and Win10 apps are consistent. Not sure if they made some changes when things were down, but I am closer to enjoying the cool "when it works" status more regularly. Battery life may still be an issue, but knowing it relied on a battery, I already purchased a back so I just might have to swap out a bit more frequently than expected.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Steve Hampe
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

Ordered a replacement and returned the original. New Ring 3 works great! It took a day or two to get the motion detection where I needed it, but all is well now.

title: Do not buy!
content: This is easily one of the worst purchases I have made.  It was recommended by an electrician and I’m sorry I listened to him.  It’s notable that Amazon asks to rate on motion detection, night vision and picture quality with no ability to give stars for battery life, ease of removing the battery, or delay between button press and chime sound. All I needed was a simple doorbell!  How much maintenance and coddling is a doorbell worth?  It should be minimal but this ridiculous thing demands as much attention as a newborn. I have had to turn the camera off because it triggered  the chime with every car that passed even when I shortened the range as much as possible.  When the camera was on I had to recharge the battery about every week and what a joke that is.  You have to remove a microscopic screw on the BOTTOM of the case.  Where is that screw likely to go if dropped?  Would you expect to ever see it again?  On top of that  recharging the battery takes at least 8 hours if not longer. To really close the decision on this disaster of a purchase the delay between pressing the doorbell and hearing the chime inside is at least 15 seconds.  A delivery man dropped a package at my front door ran back to his truck and was out of sight by the time the bell sounded.  There is no way to shorten that response time and online “help” was absolutely useless. I will probably leave the silly thing on the outside of my house just because of the aggravating hour (no kidding!) long process of trying to drill into my apparently petrified brick.  Now I’m looking for a battery free, analog cow bell to notify me when someone is at my door!
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: 30-Day Review Update
content: Thought I'd post an update based on my Ring Doorbell 3 experience after 30-days of use.... I'd give perhaps 4 stars (of 5) for the actual Ring doorbell camera. That is, the picture/video quality is good. Unfortunately, the Ring software/app/user interface still rates 1 star (of 5). I'd give 0 stars if possible for the user interface(s).  Not just my opinion...now, my experience.  The user interface, either online PC or Android App, is REALLY VERY POOR. NOT user friendly and certainly NOT intuitive to use. Currently, I have need for other cameras/devices for our house. My computer/app skills are probably average to above average for a 60 y/o mechanical engineer. I will not purchase another Ring product and I certainly won't suggest or recommend Ring because the Ring doorbell 3+ is WAY to hard to use.

title: Motion detection is 70/30
content: I wasn't expecting much from the Ring doorbell other than to be notified and be able to see who is at the door. Unfortunately even that was asking too much. Although there is no way to approach our door or front patio without being in the sensors view, it only triggers about 70% of the time. We had UPS place a package inside of storage table on the front patio, which we watched on the camera. When our son came home, he opened the table, took the package, unlocked the front door and came in and the Ring never saw anything? Many times I will walk out the front door or come in from the car and the sensor is never tripped. It's mounted on the left side of the door angled to the right, so there should be no way of not being seen. I would expect this from a $30 or $40 item, but not $180! Most likely going to return....

title: Don't bother trying to wire it to the doorbell system or to an external power source.
content: All ring products are not designed to receive enough power externally to charge the battery it even states in the package when you open it up that it cannot run without the battery relies on it to supplement power to the unit. If you try to connect it to an external power source for example the doorbell system / power adapter you will just be wasting your time and money you'd be better off just buying a second battery and charging one while the others in use. My reason for this is the makers of ring have designed it with the belief in mind that it will only record motion 5 times a day. At five triggers a day your battery will last 6 months without being hard-wired and if you do hard-wired it in it should never need changed. so before deciding to hardwire it to the doorbell or an external power source do the math at how many times you're going to actually trigger dayily...in my belief if you're going to have it go off more than 10 times a day you'd be better off just to buy a second battery and not waste your time trying to wire it up. Examples of how quickly you can rack up motion detection: A trip to and from work uses up 2 Mail delivery uses up 1 Kids going to and from school uses up 2 for every child. Your significant other going to work and coming home uses up 2 Going to walk that dog you there's another 8 uses a day. That's just the uses off the top of my head I really do love the ring I think it's a great product I'm enjoying it so far but don't waste your time trying to hardwire it. With external power supply I use 1% of the battery every 10 motion recordings without external power source I use 1% of battery every 9 motion recordings so the difference is nearly unnoticeable.

title: Wish I had gotten this sooner
content: When they say this is easy to install, it really is! I bought an Amcrest video doorbell so that I could integrate this to my zoneminder system and because it was cheaper. Short story, nothing worked and installation was much more involved than this. The ring doorbell is a simple replacement of your current doorbell. It doesn't require you to add an adapter to your chime box or anything. And, the app guides you through the installation in a breeze. Man, I wish I had bought ring doorbells years earlier. It's pretty cool how simple the app is, how quick (realtime) you get notifications and etc. My only gripe is that I wish there was a soft reboot button on the device. The instructions don't mention anything about it. Anyhow, if you needed to take out the battery to charge it and plug it back in, the ring device might not reconnect to your wifi. One way I found out how to 'soft reboot' the device was to: 1. Remove faceplate 2. Press the orange button on the top right and you'll hear "setup mode" 3. Wait a few seconds (maybe 10) and press the orange button again 4. Check the app and see if "live view" works again Despite the above issue, it's been treating me well so far. Hope that helps

title: Disappointed
content: I waited a long time before I purchased a video doorbell.  I went with the RING because of the Ratings and Reviews and because it was one of the biggest names.  I got the RING VIDEO DOORBELL and ECHO SHOW bundle.  The installation was simple and easy.  But, I am very disappointed in the performance of the RING VIDEO DOORBELL.  It takes a LONG time for either my Android OR my ECHO SHOW to actually display the video.  I mean like 30-45 seconds.  Also, the ECHO SHOW connection is very intermittent and bad.  So, someone rings my doorbell.  It takes about 10-20 seconds for the alert to come on my ECHO or phone.  Then, it takes 30 - 45 seconds for me to actually connect with my Android phone (or if I am lucky, the ECHO SHOW).  By that time, they have rang the doorbell again, which seems to mess everything up.  Anyway.  I am very disappointed in the RING VIDEO DOORBELL.  Plus, they constantly want to up sell me.  It's frustrating.  Just to clarify, I have the latest and greatest WIFI router with a 1GB internet connection, so I know that is not the issue.  I wish it just worked efficiently, consistently and reliably.  But, that has not been my experience.

title: The best Ring doorbell is the 3 plus.
content: The Ring 3 Plus model is the only one that can connect to a 5Ghz WiFi network so it responds the fastest when you need to answer a ring. It also is the only model that has the preroll feature to record 4 seconds of video before motion is triggered. Honestly this is the only ring doorbell that makes sense. I originally had the first generation Ring doorbell and it was super slow to respond even with a strong 2.4Ghz WiFi access point just inside the front door. By the time the camera loaded the person who rang the doorbell already was gone. Another major issue with the original is that video didn’t record until it was too late. I would often see the back of a package delivery guys jacket at the start of each video. If someone stole a package off my porch I’d likely just see their back too. Or when someone destroyed my wife’s flowers and beautiful plants in the front yard our Ring 1st gen camera caught nothing. In one video the flowers are there. In the next they are gone and everything stomped on. The Ring 3 Plus is the only doorbell camera model you should be looking at if you care about the actual reasons you need a doorbell cam.

title: Give it a chance
content: There seem to be a lot of mixed reviews about the Ring system, but we gave it a shot anyway. Delivery was quick, installation was relatively easy, and picture/video quality is very clear. Where we ran into problems was that the battery was draining too quickly. We live right by the road and the camer picked up every single car as "motion at the front door." After a couple days, we ended up installing the wedge mount behind the doorbell so that the camera was aimed more towards our walkway than directly at the road. We also adjusted some sensitivity settings and within the next couple of days, the doorbell got its act together and stopped picking up on passing cars, and our battery stopped draining so quickly. We also bought a replacement battery, which is convenient so you can just switch in the new battery while the other battery charges. If you are having issues, I'd suggest talking to customer service. This product works great when all of the settings are where they're supposed to be.

title: Good, but the concept of the Smart Home only exists if you go all in with one ecosystem
content: So far I really like this doorbell with one exception. Installation was easy, as was setup.  Took longer to perform a firmware update than it did to get the device installed in front of my home. Connectivity seems to be good so far too.  Can't comment on the battery life yet, but I have all the settings turned to moderate so we'll see. Still trying to figure out how not to get chimed when I go to check my mail, but that's probably just some settings in the motion detection that need tweaking. The big negative is that I use Nest WiFi and Google Home as my primary wifi / hub and Ring absolutely refuses to play nice with it.  I get that they're competing products, but it's pretty ridiculous that these two "smart" devices are purposely dumbed down so as to not work with each other.  Truth of the matter is, this doesn't make me want to get either an Alexa speaker or a Nest doorbell.  It makes me leery of buying from either brand going forward. Hopefully they'll get this fixed.  But for now, if you primarily use Google Home, prepare to be disappointed.

title: Battery Mode Unacceptable
content: First of all, battery mode gives you primitive motion zone setting ability. Just a few course blocks of the filed of view available for on/off motion detecting. But the battery life appears to be terrible, with 8 feet to access point and very few motion events logged so far, the fully charged battery has depleted 28% in 2 weeks. title: Needs weekly recharge
content: Bought a Ring Doorbell 3 to replace a 4 year old Ring Doorbell 1 with a battery that used to last at least a month. I noticed quick battery drain since the first day with the Doorbell 3. The first charge lasted 5 days with very few events recorded. Doorbell 3 does a good job at detecting persons during motion detection, useful for installations on busy streets. During the second charge, I disabled motion detection, hourly snapshots and live view, basically it was just activated by someone pushing the button. With just two doorbell events, battery still lasted less than a week. Tried contacting support and all they could suggest was to hardwire the unit or improve WiFi strength, which the Device Health reports as good. I was on hold for over an hour and was disconnected a few times, never got a call back after last disconnection. I bought Ring due to the option to operate only on battery, if I must deal with hardwiring, I’d consider other brands that integrate well with my other security products. I have no choice but return it.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Eddie D
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: A better update than expected.
content: I’ve had the Ring Video Doorbell 2 for about 3 years. I live in an apartment and can’t position any kind of internet access closer than 3 stories above. This was always an issue. Yes the 2.4 signal reaches further but it’s much slower. I was able to make use of it by getting a beast of an extender. Anyway when I saw this version had the 5ghz range I was excited to see if it’d make much of a difference. I installed the doorbell, and first hooked it up to the 2.4ghz network the v2 was on. Very similar performance. Then although it wasn’t showing a great signal at all I connected to the 5ghz and boom, this thing is working like a charm. Super quick connection and pretty solid. I decided to spring for the “pro” model, because with the version 2 it often seemed like a recording started a little too late, especially with motion. The pre-roll feature is really cool and useful. Glad I went with it. The other big change was having the newer motion zone. I live in a building without any kind of space between the entrance and sidewalk, so the bell is right on the sidewalk. This made me not use the motion feature on the v2 because there’s constantly people walking by and the battery would die. I’ve noticed using the new motion zone as well as the person detection and turning the sensitivity down, that so far so good with the battery life and using motion on a well trafficked area.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: J. Foulke
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: doesn't work right.
content: At first it didn't work correctly.  It was routinely missing detecting  people on my front porch, which is half if it's purpose. Customer service was "not available" on their web site.  I tried all of the settings the best I could but to no avail.  In response to my review, I was contacted by customer service and they walked me through the setting that needed to be changed by phone.  Everything works now.  I like that it is able to be hardwired, using the battery as backup.  I have to say that most of the settings were intuitive, but a few were not, but once you get it figured out it is great.  For some reason, there is a bit less flexibility with the motion zones in comparison to version 1.  Version 1 was completely customizable whereas version 3 (this one) divided my porch into 4 zones that I can turn on and off.  This does not allow me to put a line between the yard and the street, and so it picks up a lot of cars.  I'm not sure if those same 4 zones are for everybody of if they were based on my porch in particular, as one of the borders aligns exactly with my support post.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: c
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Some drops in signal, overall great product
content: So we needed some home security but we didn’t want to break the bank. The good news , ring doorbell works 90-95% of the time , there are moments of dropped service. We have it on battery, and it this point it’s looking like we will get a month of battery use if not more before needing to re charge. That a plus , I was worried I would be charging this thing every week but it looks like once a month or maybe once very two months. Our doorbell is about 10 feet from our router but we still have very random drops in service. There will be random times it won’t catch us coming or going from the house, but again it’s sparse and random and not often enough to make me Feel like I am being cheated or sold a bad product. It works over wifi so honestly I would be more surprised if it never lost signal. Setup and installation was a breeze. The app and all the settings are easy to use. It does give us peace of mind being able to see the motion alerts  and being able to answer my door bell on the other side of the city via the app is a very cool feature. For the price I am not upset , and I am happy with my purchase, just know that if you are reading this and looking for the main drawback of such and affordable camera doorbell the drops in service is the big one.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Do not buy!
content: I bought this and a bunch of other Ring products. A week after installing the doorbell it stopped working and will no longer show live view video feeds, the doorbell doesn't work and it doesn't detect motion. I tried following the steps provided by Ring to reset the doorbell and change it's internet connection, it didn't work at all. There is a little orange button that is supposed to put the doorbell in setup mode and it doesn't even work. The Ring Doorbell 3 Plus I purchased is just dead, it does nothing. The light around the doorbell button comes on! thats about it. This is a common problem with Ring doorbells I found after I searched online. Some kind of firmware issue where the doorbell works for a few days and then dies.

title: Beyond extremely satisfied and impressed. No regrets with this purchase
content: I have to say I am super duper impressed at this product. I am a big time nerd-techy person and I have been eyeing the Ring for some time now. I do not have a hard wired doorbell and I was excited when I did my research and read the reviews watched videos and I finally made the purchase. The features are incredible from the quality of doorbell itself, the installation which was fairly easy about 15 min max, the set up (which only took less than 15 min) the only small issue I had was the WiFi connection on the app but very minimal time lost. The Ring app itself is also very impressive from the ease of navigation, set up assistance, interface and user friendly as all the options available. The video quality both daytime and night vision is spot on. It can look a tiny bit grainy when on night-vision depending on the weather which is a given but not by much. Everything was very well packaged and labeled and all tools were included. Again I am beyond impressed and I will be purchasing more Ring products. Many props to the makers of this product.

title: It works great
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Overall, the ring package was great. Tools included, short n long screws, etc. My vinyl siding was 4 inches. Too small to use the wedge included, so i had to buy another vinyl siding surface block fr Amazon,special order at my lowes. I couldn't install over my existing doorbell, as opening the door would block the ring camera. I managed to get it installed. Charge the battery before u do anything, it took 6 hours for mine. The app installed n connected to ring ok after I got everything in front of my wifi box, it wouldn't install from my wifi extender, why, I don't know. Update:I detached everything n then attached the corner kit that angles the camera with the longest screws that reach into the siding, so my entire sidewalk was in the camera range. After that bracket was screwed into the surface block n siding, I screwed the ring doorbell into the bracket using the smallest screws. Now my ring picks up my complete walkway. They give you all sizes of screws.

title: Motion detection is terrible updated to good
content: I bought a whole bunch of devices and was really looking forward to this door bell. I even bought 2 but the motion detection is terrible.  I have to walk all the way up to it about 2 feet before motion is detected.  I was hoping at least 10 feet out.  My detection zone is set correct as well but I don’t know why it’s so terrible with detection.  Some times I can walk within 1 feet and motion is not detected.  I even set it to max sensitivity.  Very very disappointed.  Since it’s only day 1, I will play with it a little more but if things don’t improve I’m going to return for a replacement.  I thought motion is up to 30 feet?  My stick up camera has good motion distance.  Why isn’t the doorbell the same or better?  It costs more. Update: so after giving this some time it’s working pretty good.  I think I had an incorrect setting with snooze without knowing what it does.  Now detection and alert is working as expected.  For some reason though my front door bell is draining batteries faster than my back.  They are both door bell 3 and battery operated and set to same for all settings and traffic is pretty much the same.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Naste
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Lag, Person Detection, Better Night Vision are my hopes for the future
content: Night vision, motion detection and lag are the primary things which keep this product from getting 5 stars.  When there is someone at the door, or motion is detected, there is a good sized lag before you can see the video on your phone.  sometimes it is long enough to miss the guest and the opportunity to answer the doorbell call.  Night vision is just ok.  There are features I would like to see work better: the geofencing for the area of motion detection is too simple.  I was under the belief that you could create your own shape of geofence, but that feature isn't there yet.  I do receive too many detection alerts for passing traffic.  I have turned on the feature for Person Recognition but it still alerts on large trucks as artifacts.  I would suggest to RING that instead of having a Person Detection feature, why don't they try the opposite and have a Passing Vehicle Detection feature that ignores alerts.  I like that they include the wedges with the product now instead of having to buy them separately.

title: Set-Up Was A Breeze
content: First, I'll just say that I think this version of Ring is a little overpriced. However, I'll say that it is very convenient and easy to use. I wired it to my existing doorbell after removing the old bell from the wall. Unfortunately, there is a problem with my existing doorbell because once I wired and installed it, the app said it was running on batt power, meaning there was no power going through it from the house. I believe this is not a Ring issue. By downloading the app, and following the set-up instructions, I was able to do it completely in about an hour. I like the accurate motion sensor. I like the "Modes," like "Away," "Home," etc. The video quality is good. Unfortunately, since it cannot be hooked up to my existing bell and chime, I needed to buy the Ring Chime (an additional $50!) but aside from that, I'm overall happy with this smart doorbell. I also like that it comes with everything needed for install including a drill bit for stucco, as well as two brackets for ideal positioning. Would recommend.

title: Over Hyped!!!!
content: Over hyped!!!! It’s not as good as it is promoted to be! I have a battery operated base model that works twice as good as this “Enhanced” model, with one exception, the image quality is better, not great just better, if.............you can get an image to come up before it times out!!! That really upset me when I hooked it up. Since this is supposed to be the faster, better image, better motion area selection, “Enhanced” model, I had high expectations but in real life use applications, it’s slower, picture quality is marginally better and in my personal opinion it not worth the the extra money. If I didn’t have a moral conscience, I would send it back but I don’t have the heart to do that and I’m just chalking it up to “lessons learned”!

title: Great ONLY if it’s hard wired

It was hard wired to an existing doorbell system but suddenly stopped ringing the hard wired doorbell. I couldn’t figure it out. Then I moved to a new house that doesn’t have a hard wired doorbell. I thought the battery should last for a few months, but I’ve been here for 2 weeks and the battery is down below 40%. Why is there no power cable for this doorbell like the one that Ring sells for the Ring Doorbell Pro? To hardwire this, I would need to pay an electrician to wire in a doorbell transformer. This is unacceptable. The Solar charger is too big for the area that the doorbell needs to be installed on and I doubt I’d get enough sunlight on Solar Babel’s to make a difference.

title: After 3 months
content: So I bought a ring 3 about 3 months ago and have been using it since I’d say my expectations were a little high and I was let down I don’t have a big front yard and my front door isn’t very far from my drive away at all maybe 10 feet the quality of the camera is “okay” and that’s all don’t expect anything good or great I’ve had people come to my house while I was gone for example the census and couldn’t even read the license plate on their car bright and nice day.  at night it’s even worse this camera is only good if the person is within 10 feet maybe of your front door and then you could maybe recognize the face and at night that number plummets to within 3-5 feet so if I could go back I probably wouldn’t get this again I would look for something a little better and pay 50-100 more cause if someone is going to break into my house while I’m work and the camera can’t even pick up a license plate incase there wearing masks then I don’t want it this is really only good if you’ll be home at night and expect a lot of packages to be dropped off during the day while your at work and live in a really good area maybe you wanna tell the man to leave it somewhere else

title: Good idea, but need to plug into power
content: Update 2 months later: Once the doorbell has been plugged into power, power reading has bounced between 60-90%. The device works MUCH better when plugged into power - wired is a MUST. Changed rating from 3 to 4 stars. Original Post: I’m a “nest hello” guy, but when google bought nest, I figured I would give Amazon/Ring a go... got the Ring 3 and was super excited about the battery, not having to mess around with adding a transformer to the existing wiring.... (for a different property than nest) Battery lasted less than 2 weeks with minimal settings configured. Had issues with wifi, so I got a chime pro, that DID fix that issue. But I did end up having to hook up the doorbell to the existing wiring because 2 weeks of battery life is unacceptable. It’s been one week since hooking it up to power, and the battery shows 80%, at this rate it will last just over a month? We’ll see.

title: No security screws, dismal support for 2 homes
content: Seems like an OK product, but marred by a couple of issues that were really annoying. In my order of 2 ring 3 doorbells (1) neither ring came with security screws and (2) I am using these 2 at home & already have a Ring at our vacation home. It was almost impossible to work out how to view the new doorbells - instructions that came with the unit were useless, as was online help. Only my vacation home Ring was shown. My new Rings were nowhere to be found. Surely this must be a common scenario! The "Locations" & "Address" help topics on-line were worse than useless - actively misleading in this scenario. Only one address can be entered! Finally figured it out by trial & error (an inconspicuous dropdown arrow). Also, the app (latest version) encourages one to link to one's Amazon account. I tried, & it kept saying that the password was incorrect. NO it was not - I finally logged in to Amazon on a browser, entered the IDENTICAL password, and it was accepted.  Altogether an annoying, buggy, ill-thought-out, time-wasting experience. We'll see how well the cameras work in practice. I might update this review in light of later experience.

title: It is pretty cool but
content: The ring is a nice addition to our vacation home.  Adjusting the motion sensitivity down to a place were cars 30 feet away didn't set it off was a challenge.  I think I got it.  Also getting the alerts 30 seconds after they happen and then having to "rewind" to try and see what set it off is a little silly too.  If there is still motion it should go direct to live so you can "talk" to the person.  If the motion is stopped, it should go to the beginning of the recording.  Many recordings only showed the tail of a car for a quarter of a second before nothing.  It made it hard to figure out what caused the motion.

Even after adding 2 more wedges for my porch with 3 steps, it recorded an event at 1:55 for 35 seconds and then missed an Amazon delivery at 2:00. It’s missed big events like us leaving and coming home during the day, but it gets all the cars and squirrels. Tried all zones on at max sensitivity, person detection on and off, you name it, we’ve tried it. Edit 1: I got a notice that the battery is dying. It’s only lasted two weeks Edit 2: when I was setting it back up after recharging the battery overnight, I happened to notice they upgraded the motion zones functionality. This makes a huge difference (not nearly as many cars are being recorded going down the street), but the camera still misses a lot of action.

title: 50/50 chance for a live feed. Watch my video.
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Watch the video I have provided. I have purchased multiple brands of security cams. This is the only one where I can say I cannot trust that I can watch live when I need it. Far faster internet connection than needed, but still the same issue. I have spoken to multiple people I know who own ring, and I have yet to have anyone say this issue doesn’t happen to them, city or country. If you don’t trust reviews in here, ask one single person you know and I will bet they have had the issue before. I have zmodo cameras all around my house that provide video instantly....instantly. Pros 1) cloud price and warranty 2) ease of installation Cons 1) Have had people set off the motion time and time again and not be able to get a live view for several minutes, sometimes longer. Couldn’t be more stressful. Switched over to my zmodo cameras for live view quickly.

title: It works and so does Ring support
content: I purchased three Ring 3 video doorbells, one for each entrance to our home. Two of them are hardwired to a 24 V doorvell circuit and the third operates on battery power. The installation was easy but I had to buy a separate pack of wedge kits because of my vinyl siding pitch. The setup took some getting used to but all three worked for about one week. That is when one of the doorbell powered units would not connect with my phone even though it was closer to my wifi router than the other two. A call to Ring Support let me talk to Fatima and she walked me through some checks, and got the device reconnected. I experienced the same thing on two more occasions but was able to get it working on my own. If it keeps happening I will push for a replacement but I am thoroughly satisfied with the Ring product and their customer support.

content: PLEASE SEE MY 12/4/20 REVIEW UPDATE BELOW. Constantly disconnects from my WiFi. Rings answer is to reboot the router or move the router closer to the ring.
