title: Device appears to be fairly good but tech support sucks. Maximum range is only about 15 feet.
content: Got the device installed it. The 30 ft or greater motion detection only works to about 15 feet. The tech support is terrible, you have to go through a robot phone tree then answer questions and then you get somebody in India that does not speak American English. That may be okay for people with perfect hearing but I have a very hard time with it. The pamphlet that comes with it is of no use for troubleshooting. The device does not have a delete all function so if you walk in and out of your house you're going to have to delete each one of those individually. Then they do stupid things like use the word neighbor when they mean customer.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Eric
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Don't waste your money
content: Very pathetic for the price.  Hit or miss if it picks up motion.  Have been using now for a few weeks and have adjusted motion zone and sensitivity, but really random results.  I have tried setting it so that it would detect when the mailman delivers mail.  Mailbox is at the end of the driveway and Ring has not once detected mail being delivered.  However, when an early postal delivery vehicle drives by in the morning, it is detected.  Even didn't detect when the postal worker actually delivered a package that was left on the door step.  Other issue is that I have the Ring hardwired to existing door chime which helps keep the battery charged, but was also configured to ring the existing door chime, which worked at the time of setting up.  Now the chime no longer "chimes" when the doorbell is pushed.  Nothing has been reset, just quit working.  Really wishing I hadn't purchased.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Kevin H.
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Ring Doorbell with Battery
content: I purchased the Ring Doorbell with the battery several months back  expecting a pretty good product after reading all the reviews and hype. I decided to wait till I write a review to see how well this product works.  I am sad to say there is a lag in notifications when someone drops off a parcel.  I purchased the Ring Doorbell to help alleviate porch thieving in my area.  The other dissatisfaction I have is the battery is supposed to last like 6 months?  Are you kidding me?  It doesn't last close to 3 weeks!  I even purchased an extra battery and I am glad I did.  It's a pain to change every 3 weeks!  So if anyone of you are considering Ring with a battery, I'd suggest further research and get a hardwired device.  Totaly not happy with this.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Catz
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Not all of the Ring’s are perfect.
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Had the ring 2 and I loved it, but I didn’t like the lag when you pressed the screen to see the video. The 5ghz in the ring 3 is so much better, and the picture comes up way quicker so you won’t miss anything. I don’t notice anything else different. However, when I received my ring 3, there was a line in the screen. I’m thinking it is a camera defect. As you can tell from my screen recording, my phone is fine. It’s the camera itself. Customer support/Tech support was no help, and I had to jump through hoops to try and get this fix. Even hard reset the device, AND re-connected it to my phone from scratch, but still had the same issue. I got tired of wasting time talking to them, and did a exchange instead. When it’s clearly a hardware issue, they need to learn to just initiate the exchange for another one. Hopefully the next ring 3 will not have this defect.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Fidel
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: It's nice compared to the 1st version
content: If I compare products, the first ring doorbell and this one, then I would definitely notice the difference,  and the video quality. I bought it with a special deal, I do think the battery durability needs more work, it doesn't last as long as the 1st ring doorbell, and if the price is going to be higher then the product should meet the expectations. I have the new ring set with the recommended settings,  I have tried multiple things to help the battery last longer, but it's not working, 4 days tops it's the longest we got. So I ended up buying another battery, because charging it also takes over 8 hours,  sometimes even more,  which makes no sense to me. Overall. The product is  fine,  it needs some work.  But the video quality is great.

title: Good Product!
content: The first one that I received has power issus that could only last few weeks with a fully charged battery. I worked with Ring support team and tested 3 battery, and finally figured out that the issue is about the doorbell. They replaced the doorbell with another new one for me. That one works as expected, with all functions like motion detection and live streaming, and use 1-2 times a day, the battery lasts 2 months now and still has 30% life.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: AL
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Don’t disconnect your old doorbell.
content: I gave up on Ring one because I had to reprogram it every time the power or Internet went out.  Ring2 waw a great improvement with a chargeable battery. That worked better , but I was still having to reprogram it by removing the battery, Taking off the faceplate, pushing a button, and doing several steps on my iPhone.  Even with the hard wiring, I had to manually recharge the battery often . A tech friend encouraged  me to buy ring3 because it would use both  2.4 and 5 signals.  No improvement. I have a deco mesh Wi-Fi system which works great. It takes too many steps and time to answer the doorbell,  even with rapid ring. And it frequently does not work at all.  I live in a city. Is the problem too many ring doorbell’s, poor design, poor Internet service, or something else?
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Merklebee
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Worked well for about two weeks
content: We had the Ring video doorbell 2, with which we were initially very pleased but which quit working well within a few months (see our review for that).  We then bought the 3 - since we already have good spare batteries from the 2 -  thinking the 3 would be "improved."  Big, expensive mistake.  The 3 worked well for about two weeks, and after about two months only notified AFTER a person was Actually At the Door, and more often when the person was already half way back to the street.  As with the 2, we tried resetting the doorbell, our phones, our wifi, the app settings, the position of the ring, everything tech support said to try for the 2 - which didn't improve anything - and have finally given up.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: The Rarely Reviewer
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Useless without the ring monthly service
content: With the monthly subscription service, this product is 5/5. Without the monthly service, this product is 1/5. I know the monthly service is not costly, however the doorbell loses virtually all functionality without it. You can not see any past video captures what-so-ever. For example, if you get a notification "there is motion at your door" and open the app immediately, you cannot see what event even triggered the alert. Without the Ring service the only thing you can do is live view. Before my Ring service expired, I was able to go into live view without any errors. Now that the ring service has expired, I have trouble every time. I get a reconnecting error and I have to refresh multiple times. Taking 30 or so seconds to access the live view. Whatever triggered the Ring is long gone.  I am certain this is a programmed feature so that it also makes it difficult to use even the live view without the monthly subscription service. DO NOT buy this product without knowing that you will HAVE to get the monthly subscription service. Just another corporation cash grab.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Jeremy Lee
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Extremely disappointed
content: This app is terrible. I bought a ring for the first time a couple of days ago and I’ve had so many issues with it. First the app is not user friendly. There are way too many settings to figure out not to mention the annoying unread notifications for different app features. Second, my ring won’t show me a live feed and is stuck on the activating device screen. My WiFi is 300mbs...I tested it. To top it all off I cannot get rid of the neighborhood alert push notifications. I even called ring, was on hold for 30 minutes, downloaded and reinstalled the app and guess what notification I see an hour later? I will probably return this piece of junk and buy a different brand. DISAPPOINTED

title: Good doorbell - but don’t waste money on the “Protect Plan”
content: The doorbell is very good. But beware of the protect plan scam. I paid $100 per year for three years, but when one camera broke and I tried to use the extended warranty they refused to cover the camera because one year earlier my credit card failed and it took a few weeks to get the new card started. They never notified me that they were canceling all my extended warranty coverage, and continued sending me billing statements in future years saying “all your equipment will be covered by the extended warranties.”

title: PITA
content: Originally purchased Ring Pro, worked great but the audio quality at the door bell was terrible with choppy/muffled results using android and iPhone devices. Bought the new Ring 3, slow to connect, the person at the door hears us fine, but we can't hear them. The suggested fix is to remove cover and reset the ring device. WHAT A PAIN! Save yourself time and frustration and look at different brands. BA BYE RING!

title: Put a Ring on it!
content: All the single ladies out there, if you're not looking to put a ring on your finger, put one on your doors! I feel much safer knowing who is at my door before I answer it and can see all the activity around my doors with the motion detection. Alert push notifications pop up on my phone and I can be aware of deliveries of packages when I'm not home. Love this product and ease of installation. Charging is simple. No hardwire required.

title: Doesn’t warrant the price
content: We replaced our original Ring with the Ring 3.  The original Ring had the capability to adjust the motion detection by seeing your yard and street.  The Ring 3 for some reason has taken that capability away.  All you get now is a screen that you set to min to max the sensitivity without seeing anything.  Your basically guessing.  How do they think your suppose to adjust without seeing what you are adjusting.  They also have taken away the feature of being able to delete multiple recordings at one time.  The only thing that is better is the 1080p but not sure it warrants the price.

title: Ring 3 - Save your $!!
content: Don’t waste your money! I have purchased the original ring video doorbell when it first came out and was moderately impressed but after a couple of years the novelty wore off when the hardware couldn’t keep up with the software. Customer service kept trying to imply that I had a weak router or bad connection. I have a mesh network that goes far beyond my house perimeter, so that’s ridiculous! I decided to upgrade to the ring three thinking it was time for a whole new system and I’m sorry to say it’s even worse!! Not sure what they call night vision but I have ring stick up cam‘s that are fabulous and they have excellent night vision. Why they can’t put that technology into the product that’s the corner stone of their brand I have absolutely no idea!

title: Falls a bit short of expectations
content: I’ve been using this for about a month now. Overall, it’s a fair product, but not great. Installation: Pretty smooth — I also hooked it in to the existing chime. Video quality: It’s okay, but not great. And night vision is completely non-existent. Audio quality: Decent, but a little choppy. Motion detection: The zones don’t actually work. I turned the zone “off” that covers the street, but my alert still goes off every time a car passes by. Service: Disappointing that there’s no SD slot for on-board video storage (for those of us who don’t want to pay another $10+/month subscription. Once the free trial expires, I’ll only be able to live-stream — no recording capability. Overall, it’s a fun tech gadget, but doesn’t quite meet the mark.

title: Love these cameras, have 4
content: They are great for security and keeping you alerted at motion. They also integrate with Alexa and the Alexa Fire Tv really well for those boring quarantine nights when you are totally out of things to do so it turns into some kinda Alfred Hitchcock Rear Window thing... "Alexa! Show me the front door! *front door pops up on 55inch TV*. Wow, the neighbors are wrestling something in the trunk of their car. Wait, what is that? WAS THAT AN ARM?!?!?! OH NO they have a body in their trunk, I just know it! Oh, it's groceries and that's a baguette of bread. Glad I didn't call the police". Great product for security and being nosey.

author: clay282
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Not A User Friendly App....and Wedge Is Awkward With Solar Charger
content: It's only been 24 hrs since my Ring 3 Plus has been installed and I'll give it more time but first impressions are quite negative. The motion detection chime was going off at least once a minute, perhaps from the wind. So I turned the motion sensitivity to low....and it still chimed every minute. So I turned off the motion alert...and it's still chiming every minute! So I turned off Ring Alerts....and it's still chiming every minute. Now I disabled motion detection and it's still ringing every minute. I have an Arlo security camera which can specify the exact areas for coverage. Ring has predetermined areas which can be turned on and off. But I have stairs in front of my house and if I choose the stairs only it's a very limited area of coverage. Being able to exactly specify areas of coverage would be nice. I bought a solar charger but I did not read any notice that it would not work well with a wedge. The wedge, included in the package to angle the camera down the stairs, and the solar charger are basically incompatible. I had to disconnect the Ring Chime Pro because it was a loud sound chime every minute within the house. Now my chime alert is only on the Ring outside the house but still obvious to everyone inside. The Ring App for Macs at the Apple Store has only a 2 star review (out of 5). I would have expected that the high priced Ring would have a higher user rating.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus Configuration: Doorbell only

product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

title: Beware: subscription required
content: I tried a cheaper video doorbell and had nothing but problems. It would not stay connected to my WiFi, whenever I experienced a power outage it would require a hard reset and it would monitor the entire camera space instead of just my doorstep (it would alert me every time a car passed). The Ring video doorbell fixed all those issues. Update: the Ring doorbell will disconnect from WiFi and there is not a message or alarm to alert you when it does. Additionally my old video doorbell accepted a storage card, Ring does not. It's already priced at the top of the market and it requires an additional monthly subscription to be able to record. Disappointing.

title: It dosen't work most of the time :(
content: When it works it is great. Trouble is, it doesn't work most of the time. We are in a very small house, Ring is near the wi-fi. It chimes when it wants to, rarely chimes when it is supposed to. We added a wi-fi boster thinking that would help, nope. Problems include but aren't limited to; in any setting, home, away, disarmed it 'ghost alerts'. On the other hand, often in any of those settings it won't alert nor will the doorbell ring when pushed. You can push the doorbell in any of the settings and it may or may not load to the phone. When testing you can hit doorbell and often, when it rings it takes forever to open the ap to see what is going on. There are still too many glitches to have this on the market. If someone knows the answer or has advice please share. If it doesn't work properly soon we will send it back.

content: I had high Hope's for this, but it's just not working  for me. The doorbell is always going offline. Sometimes I'll get a notification and it will playback only blackness. I noticed for 3 days straight it was offline. I couldn't figure out why. Even though the app said I had a full battery, I  went ahead and took the battery out to see if it would charge,  which it turned out to be the battery  was dead after only 2 weeks. After that I made it so that my only active zone was the front porch. Ring doorbell missed about 5 people coming up to my front porch,  including the delivery guy, and the person that took my package off my porch. This thing is awful!

The ring is literally a free security system. No longer do I rush home for deliveries. I will sometimes forget I even have a delivery while it sits out their for a few days. I have so much piece of mind the the ring doorbell. Easy to install and takes away lots of stress.

title: Not Going Great So Far - Disappointed By Support
content: I got the Ring 3. Initially I liked it, everything seemed to be going great. Problems started a month in, when I needed to remove and charge the battery for the first time. The  battery wouldn't charge at all, no matter what I tried,  so I contacted Ring for a replacement part. They agreed it was an issue, and ordered a new battery to be sent. It's been 3 weeks and several calls to support and no battery in sight. I bought this camera because my house was broken into and I wanted to put some cameras around, and now I'm almost a month without security and Ring doesn't seem to care or take it seriously. I'm really surprised that it wasn't overnighted in the first place, and now that it's several weeks delayed, I'm in disbelief. They need to do better, especially for a first-time customer. I'm seriously thinking of returning it and buying a doorbell camera from a brand with better support, if this is what I can expect from them.

title: It makes my life so much easier
content: I have lost enough packages that I want to do something to fix this. This doorbell is one of the Best Buy I have done for myself. I get to monitor my front door whenever and wherever. The quality of the pictures and videos is great! And audio is great too! Love how I can speak with the person at my door and listen to them even I am not home. The motion detector is great to know if my package has arrived or if anyone is trying to steal my package again. The only thing is that, I wish I can configure the motion detecting area. My house is in front of a kinda busy street so I get tons of noises... this is the only down side. Yet it also proves the motion detecter is very sensitive. The installation was easy as well! Anyways, it saves my life! I love it!

title: Does not work at least half of the time.
content: Horrible. I have had problems from the beginning with it staying connected to my wifi. Live view only works, at most, about half the time.  Motion detection, maybe about 2/3 of the time. I have done everything possible to make sure that it isn't a problem with my router/internet connection, including buying a new router.  No other device in the house has these problems, except for the Chime Pro that I also have, and the doorbell is the closest device to the router (about 10 feet).  The Chime Pro, about 20 feet from it.  The chime also loses its connection on a regular basis, and usually reconects after unplugging & plugging back in.  Sometimes, the doorbell is fine for a while after removing the battery, then putting it back in, but eventually goes back to having problems within a day or two. I recently purchased & set up a Ring stick up camera, and that one has had no problems, and is the farthest device in the house from the router.

title: People only mode?!
content: The video quality on this camera is great and so is night vision. My issue with this Ring doorbell that cost $300 is that the sound goes out every now and then so o have to remove the battery and reinsert.  The second issue I have is that this doorbell doesn’t have the “People only” mode. According to the Ring website battery operated devices are supposed to have that feature. Considering the amount of money it should have that feature and the sound shouldn’t go out every other month. Overall it still does what it’s supposed to and I’m pleased with that. I just really hate getting a motion notification for every vehicle that goes down my road.

title: Works very well.

The mic works great to talk back. There is a slight delay getting of about 5 seconds when you ask Alexa to show front door. I wish I could connect it to my own computer to store video. That would eliminate the subscription service. But if you add camera and get a higher subscription it might be worth it. If you want more cameras around the house you can get them but you need to stay with RING cameras. Well worth the price.

title: easy to install and set up
content: decent products and easy to install & set up. However, there customer support is ridiculously bad. Call centers asking repeated questions with no resolutions. After they directed me to delete their app & re-install and I did. It wouldn't allow me to sign in again. They prompted me to sign on numerous times. The "system" detected the numerous sign on attempts and now the "system" has me locked out. After they told me to do all that I was told, "sorry you've tried too many times there's nothing we can do, it's been given a heightened status and we'll get back to you. That was six days ago and I'm still unable to utilize their products nor view anything on app. I was also told, "due to these issues they'll give me two months free." My reply was, " if you give me a lifetime of free what good is free service on something you can't use? Very big disappointment.

title: I wanted the Ring Doorbell Pro
content: I am out the cost of the Ring Video Doorbell 3 with Echo Show 5.  I ordered this by mistake. What I wanted was the Ring Doorbell Pro.  I waited for the storm door we ordered to be installed before opening the box, and missed the window for returning it by a couple of days.. title: Not compatible with my doorbell, sluggish on motion detection
content: I really had high hopes for the Ring Doorbell. I've wanted to get one for years, and I finally decided to bite the bullet and purchase one. If you're planning to get one, my bit of advice is to check to make sure your doorbell is actually compatible with it first. Seriously. Find your doorbell if you have a nice one, check the transformer on it, and see what kind of power it lists in the Output section. If you have a normal Ding-Dong doorbell, check your transformer and check the output for that. After I received the Ring Doorbell 3, I had help hooking it up. We used the existing doorbell wires, but the Ring wouldn't acknowledge that it received electricity (where it should have displayed "Hardwired" on the Device Health in the app, it simply shows "Battery." It also wouldn't ring through to my existing doorbell chime that came with the house that I built 4 year ago (for anyone who is interested, my doorbell is # 18888 (Input: 120VAC 60Hz. Output: 12VDC 6ms). After some research, I found that it's because the power that comes off of the doorbell chime box is not compatible with the Ring 3; it lets off the wrong kind of power (DC instead of AC). So, if I want to actually hear the doorbell ring, I will need to either spend more money and have an electrician come out and put in a new transformer and doorbell, or I will need to spend more money and get a Ring Chime. Either way, having to spend more money bites. Next up, sometimes when someone rings the doorbell, it doesn't ring through and they end up having to knock. This hasn't happened nearly as much as the next problem I'm listing below. The motion detection isn't all that great. Someone could have been at my door, and I've already let them in, and we're already talking for a few minutes before I get notified that there was motion when they arrived minutes ago. I've checked my internet and everything is running fine, so I don't see that as being the issue. Overall, unfortunately, I wish I wouldn't have wasted my money. I miss my normal doorbell, but I don't want a bunch of holes on the front of my house, if I were to remove the Ring.
variant: Style: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Configuration: Doorbell only
author: Krissy
product: Ring Video Doorbell 3 Plus – enhanced wifi, improved motion detection, 4-second video previews, easy installation

I was up and running within 20 mins Video and picture quality is excellent when HDR is enabled in the app settings Motion and notifications -  I have a palm tree that is in view and it has not triggered any false notifications when the foliage is flapping in the wind. When I tested motion by opening the front gate or entering/exiting the front door an alert is triggered every time. The intercom is solid. There is no lag or audio issues. Voice clarity is really good. It’s pretty much like using my iPhone on speaker Battery Life - This was my main concern but so far it’s holding up exceptionally well. After a little over a week my battery is at 95% The  Ring app has a clean UI and it’s very easy to use. Overall I am very pleased with Ring Doorbell 3 Plus and I would recommend it.

title: Want it to go live like my other cameras
content: Very difficult to hook to live Have even put a Wi-Fi booster on it 10 ft from it obviously in the house My driveway and inside camera go live by just touching them I wonder if I just have a bad one It may take 3 times to get it to go live Ok Let me update my first comment that Amazon had requested from me. Well let me see  where do I start. I watched a lot of Ring Commercials after losing my existing wired alarm system. I ordered most of my Ring devices from Amazon and if you didn't know they own Ring. Now i'm kinda annal so I ordered everything that could apply to the system. All the extenders and chime pro devices. Anything that would make it work like the commercials. Even the Amazon Echo 8 which will show me and allow me to see and talk to who's at the door or driveway. The doorbell 3 was not out yet when I bought my system, that was about March. I was excited when I received my battery operated doorbell 3. I installed it and was immediately disappointed in a device that I had waited on,  and it didn't operate like it shows on the commercials. Because of the response above Ring support called me and told me that they wanted to resolve my issue. I found that I was talking to one of the senior support personal. He ask me if I would be willing to work with them and be a beta test for their product. I bought the system sometime in March and now its November. So we talked about every week and they worked on it for several months with the doorbell being below par. He always said I will turn it over to my tech department. My response became maybe you need to replace them because they don't seem to fix my problem. He always blamed it on my Spectrum internet which is at 400 speed. Another issue that I have is I have a 4000 sq ft house. That was part of the discussion. I don't remember in the commercials where it said this system is mainly or only for small apartments. After blaming Spectrum so much and not getting a better response. They suggested that we put in a Eero Wi-Fi extender. If you look it up it does more than just extend the Wi-Fi, it actually multiply's it. Well Amazon owns and sells this product also. At this point I can say that my whole system in on the Eero so all the extenders that I ordered are now in a drawer and not being used. The Eero is covering my whole house and I have 5 cameras and a Alexa Echo 8 and 2 Ring Pro that ring when the doorbell is activated. It is now performing well let's say 90 to 99%. If I try to get a live view of my doorbell 3 it usually opens most of the time the first time. I will say that in the morning it usually takes 5 to 8 times to open to a live view. Too be honest that is the hardest time for me to get a live view. I can say that if someone walks up to the door or by a motion detector it will open by touching the banner that is put on my phone. That is what Ring support is still working on. Although it's 95% better, it's not perfect but close to it. I also have a retrofit kit hooked to my existing wired alarm system in my house and it works great. I have to say that Ring support has been very diligent  in trying to resolve my issue, and have made a major improvement in it. The biggest improvement was the addition of the Eero system. At this point I'm  glad that I went with the Ring system and I'm very satisfied with The Ring support Team.

title: RING 3 Plus AUDIO Does NOT work after 2 seconds PROBLEM NOT fixed, NO SOLUTION available
content: Beware, AUDIO will NOT work after two seconds of 'recording' or 2 seconds of "Go LIVE", video will work fine and video will record and function as it should, but AUDIO cuts off after two seconds. Also, when someone rings the doorbell they CAN hear you for an entire conversation, but you CANNOT hear them after 2 seconds. This is noticeable AFTER the ring device is installed for 24-48 hours. The ONLY way to get it to work again is to remove and re-insert the battery. It will then work fine for about 24-72 hours then will do the same thing again. RING cust service will try to tell you it is your WIFI connection, but that is NOT true. I ran a test with mine placing the doorbell 3 feet away from router, and it does the same thing. This issue is NOT your WIFI, it is NOT your smart phone, but a software issue with RING 3 PLUS. RING software developers need to fix the issue as some internal code is telling the device to shut off AUDIO recording after two seconds. There a REDDIT article that discusses this very problem. NO real help from RING customer service. BUYER BEWARE!

title: Great for Catching Passing Cars, NOT Criminals
content: We got the ring to have more peace of mind and have a visual on what was happening in our street and on the front porch. In the less than month that we’ve had the ring mounted and installed the ring missed (1) our car being side-swiped, (2) our trashcan being stolen, (3) our neighbor ACTUALLY ENTERING our home to water our plants for us. Yet we get notifications every 5 minutes for motion detection. So what is going on? We’ve adjusted the settings multiple times to try and ensure we see what we need to in order to protect our home, but unfortunately it only seems to pick up the mailman and cars driving by our house. What a waste of $200+, I should have gotten Simplisafe. The ring doesn’t make me feel safer, in fact it puts my guard down because I thought we could trust is, and I have now been a victim to 2 different crimes thanks to its “help”. Would not recommend to anyone actually looking to secure their home.

title: Camera is made out of plastic? For over $230, not what we expected, returned.
content: Not sure why so many reviewers are fine paying over $230 for an inferior product which is made out of plastic. We didn't even bother installing it. Once we took it out of the box, we knew we would not keep this product as it felt really light and cheap in our hands, unlike our Ring floodlight cameras.  We were looking forward to having a video door bell, but this is not a product we would consider mounting at our main entrance.  To us, this is not worth the price and unfortunately, we cannot recommend this product at this time.

title: Customer Service Issues
content: I purchased and installed two Ring 3 Doorbells from Amazon, they appear to work fine.  The last step is to install a security screw which is designed to deter theft of the device. Amazon said all they could do was to offer a replacement (already installed, doesn't make sense) or a partial refund.  All I want are the screws.  Back to Ring who only offers the purchase of a spare parts kit.  So for an extra $6 (with tax and shipping) I will eventually get the screws.  Just a very frustrating dealing with customer support for both Amazon and Ring.

Not having a doorbell already was not a hinderance. The battery should last at least 6 months but the device will tell you if it’s low so that’s a benefit. Would recommend and purchase again, especially when on sale. Can’t beat the price for sure.
